title: Global Senior Product Owner
description:
Do you believe that digital is a business enabler and can be a catalyst for transformation? Do you love to do things differently, to challenge the status quo, and to find unexpected ways to enable brand and business growth? Do you develop strong and trusting relationships and know how to manage multiple stakeholders across the globe to get to the right solutions?


Then this could be the role for you.


Essity, a leading hygiene and health company committed to breaking barriers to wellbeing, is opening a job opportunity in its Global Brand, Innovation and Sustainability (GBIS) business unit. As the #4 player in Period Care globally (with brands such as Libresse, Saba, Nosotras, Nana etc), #2 in markets we compete in, the fastest growing Period Care brand globally and playing across multiple product categories such as period pads and underwear, liners, tampons, intimate washes.


Working at Essity is not just a career, it’s where you’ll play your part in a better future, working towards closing the menstrual health gap.


**About the role**

We are looking for a **Global** **Senior Product Owner** for our Period Care digital products and services (existing and future) with a focus on global brand sites (with and without DtC functionalities) as well as regional e-commerce solutions (B2C) finding synergies and optimizations. The role’s time will be 80% GBIS (direct reporting line) and 20% EMEA DTC focused on Shopify (Femcare V-Brands & Incontinence Tena)


This position located in **Gothenburg, Sweden** and reports to the Global Digital Manager Femcare. You will cooperate closely with digital, D2C and e-commerce teams in lead markets, IT, global brand, communication and innovations managers, to consistently position our brand in a territory that drives company sales growth and reaches overall Essity targets. The Global Senior Product Owner is part of our Agile Center of Excellence.


Within Essity’s Consumer Goods Business Unit in EMEA, two main categories: Essity FemCare and Essity Incontinence. DTC Femcare or Inco are available currently only for washable underwear on a Shopify webshop in France, UK. Germany has only Incontinence and the Nordics (Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway) only Femcare. In each country, there are also related brand websites, on a separate platform and URL.


**What you will do**

* Develop and maintain the digital product vision and roadmap, define the value of the global website and its role in the brand digital ecosystem and how it supports brand growth.
* Manage identified projects regarding the evolution of both DTC Shopify platforms (V-Brand & Tena), in terms of technical features and UX/UI.
* Work closely with various stakeholders and act as interface for high-level requirements; manage the website budget, document and communicate the product backlog, listen and prioritize needs, leading the agile product team which includes sprint planning and reviews, coordination of release planning and execution together with Essity IT, follow-up of service level agreements
* Measure progress and track results, drive improvements as business project and/or requirements manager
* Provide expert digital knowledge and expertise to stakeholders and ensure our Digital Operating Model is implemented

**Who you are**

* University Degree or equivalent experience (Information technology and/or Marketing)
* Minimum 5-8 years relevant experience from regional or global digital functions (preferably in a B2C context), B2B2C and DtC product websites
* Proven track record in developing website roadmaps for brand & e-commerce solutions
* Experience in CX, working with agile development frameworks, breaking down business requests to requirements for digital solutions
* Fluent in English both verbally and written, other languages (e.g. Spanish) are a plus

Furthermore, you have ability to influence key stakeholders in a global matrix organization and effectively communicate and manage work across organizational boundaries to manage global digital platforms and solutions in a collaborative way - high resilience and solution-oriented attitude. Your consumer centricity and bias towards action enables you to take initiative and make projects progress. You’re an analyst at heart, love to identify problems and develop solutions.


**Additional Information**

Please send us your application in English and send it to us through our website at your earliest convenience but not later than deadline.


**What We Can Offer You**

At Essity, we believe every career is as unique as the individual and empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.
  

Collaborative and Caring Culture | Empowerment & Engaged People | Work with Impact and A Powerful Purpose | Individual Learning & Career Growth | Health & Safety Priority | Sustainable Value Together| Innovation| Sustainable Working Life | Total Reward


#LI-VP1


**Application End Date:**
-------------------------

07 nov. 2024
**Job Requisition ID:**
-----------------------

Essity247499

title: Automotive UX Designer
description:
**At Cliff Design, we believe that Design is the power that drives change. We are working with project based commitments in our design studio as well as providing design consultants on-site at our clients design departments. We constantly need to be challenged and are always interested in connecting with dedicated creative souls.**

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a talented Automotive UX Designer to join our team. This unique role focuses on creating intuitive and innovative user experiences through the implementation, management, and control of ambient lighting, exterior light communication, interactive surfaces, and other screen based and non-screen-based interactions within our vehicles. Considering the whole scope of UX you are to challenge and innovate the way users interact with the whole eco-system of products and services.

**Responsibilities and tasks**  

* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and prioritize requirements for lighting UI features and functionality. Translate user needs and market insights into actionable design requirements.
* Create and maintain documentation, including design specifications, requirements, style guides, and user documentation for lighting UI features across several platforms.
* Communicate progress and updates to stakeholders in a clear and timely manner.
* Develop and maintain a roadmap for lighting UI development, outlining key milestones and deliverables. Prioritise features based on business value, technical feasibility, and user impact.
* Provide guidance and direction to UX/UI designers in creating visually appealing and user-friendly lighting interfaces. Ensure consistency and coherence across different lighting applications, platforms, and vehicle models.
* Work closely with engineering and development teams to ensure the successful implementation of lighting UI designs. Facilitate communication and collaboration between stakeholders throughout the development process.
**Requirements**  

* Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Media management or related field.
* Relevant working experience within UX for an automotive client.
* Good knowledge of the HMI design process and best-practices.
* Software such as Figma, Photoshop, After Effects and HTML & CSS.
* English, spoken and written.
* Proven experience (1-2 years) designing user interfaces for automotive applications.
  

**Additional information**  

* In addition to CV we will only consider applications with attached work samples (pdf-design portfolio max 8 Mb file size or a web portfolio link)

  

**Deadline for application**  

* 2024-11-04. Selection and interviews will take place continuously. The position may be filled before the closing date, so please apply as soon as possible.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Sales Discount Management (SDM)
description:
**Job ID:** 263884


**Date posted:** 24/10/2024


**What you need to know**  

  

The Sales Discount Management (SDM) Team at IKEA is responsible for providing the best Web App for our IKEA coworkers who create discounts for our products and services. We have coworkers in 30 countries using SDM in various ways. We are looking for our next awesome colleague to join us in our journey to grow our product into the easiest and most productive discount management system we can.  

  

We offer an environment where curious people can explore a complex problem space and have a big influence on what we build, and how we build it.  

  

OUR TEAM  

  

The team is an autonomous, multi-disciplinary and creative group of people coming from different backgrounds. You have your Backenders, Fullstackers, Product Specialists and Product Owner, and maybe soon a Data Analyst.
  

  

A friendly bunch who are always willing to help, all you have to do is ask. Working together to keep code clean, as well as keeping a good and steady pace of features/value we deliver to production is the tightrope we help each other walk every day.  

  

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING  

  

* Mentor and coach Engineers
* Lead initiatives on code quality and pointing out and driving the cleanup of tech debt
* Always have non-functional requirements in mind, e.g. Security, Architecture, Readability etc.
* Lead work from an engineering perspective, working closely with Product and UX design
* Live, breathe and spread a DevOps culture
* Spread a culture of end-to-end ownership of features/issues
* Spread knowledge and culture around mature automated testing
* Write beautiful and effective code
* Write effective and easy-to-maintain automated tests
* Review pull requests and help others write awesome code
* Code together with others (e.g. pair programming, mob programming etc.)
* Monitor and operate our production environments
* Work on constantly improving all aspects of our work, from process and tooling to how we measure performance
* Work with the rest of the team to scope our work, exploring our problem space
* Contribute to knowledge being shared both inside and outside the team
* Collaborate with other teams and stakeholders across the organization
* Own features/issues from idea to production to operations

  

You should apply if you are a Full stack engineer who can tick off a few of these:  

  

* Have excellent communication skills in English (not necessarily extroverted... just great at communicating clearly)
* Extensive experience in developing, releasing and operating backend applications
* You are highly skilled in Kotlin, Java or a similar language
* You are skilled in Javascript (and Typescript) and comfortable with its various flavours or frameworks
* Experience in building Cloud-based applications (preferably Google Cloud Platform)
* Enjoy leading your own work
* Are comfortable exploring scale and performance problems
* Enjoy transforming teams into a fast-paced DevOps mindset that incorporates core Agile principles

  

What’s on the table  

* Working at an awesome global company with instant brand recognition
* Working with near-bleeding-edge tech
* Excellent care for employees

  

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!  

  

If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to hiring manager Vullnet Dyla at  

vullnet.dyla@ingka.ikea.com  

  

If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to Warren Roach at  

warren.roach@ingka.com.  

  

We only accept applications with a reasonable commute to Malmö or Helsingborg  

  

We’re looking forward to receiving your application!  

  

We’re the ones who make it possible for people to have a smarter life at home and a hassle-free and rewarding shopping experience. Together we work to find new digital solutions for every business need to help make IKEA a great and efficient place to work. We like to think of ourselves as innovative and modern, and we believe that nothing would actually work without us.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Web Editor
description:
### **Job Description**


We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Web Editor to join our client's digital communications team. In this role, you will work closely with the Corporate Communications department, focusing on the management and optimization of the company’s websites. You will be responsible for publishing, updating, and enhancing website content while collaborating with internal stakeholders to ensure the website meets organizational goals.

**Responsibilities**

* Manage and optimize content within the content management system (CMS).
* Coordinate and initiate website improvement activities.
* Analyze website data and provide insights to support decision-making.
* Collaborate with various internal teams to ensure web content aligns with business objectives.

**Technical Environment**

* CMS Platforms: Sitecore, Umbraco, WordPress.
* Additional Tools: GA4, Crazy Egg, Microsoft Office.
* Note: Work requires use of a company-provided computer to access internal systems.

### **Qualifications**

* Previous experience in a similar role that combines communication and IT.
* Familiarity with CMS platforms and working in complex business environments with integrated IT systems.
* Experience in project planning and coordination.
* Proficiency in English (Swedish is advantageous but not required).

**Skills**

  

* Strong CMS knowledge.
* Data analysis capabilities.
* Understanding of SEO principles.
* Basic UX knowledge.

### **Personal Qualities**


To succeed in the assignment as a Web Editor, we would like you to be a collaborative team player who effectively engages with internal stakeholders. You should be self-motivated, taking the initiative to drive tasks forward, and demonstrate a strong attention to detail with a keen eye for accuracy.

### **When you join JobBusters**


As a consultant at JobBusters, you can feel secure with a collective agreement, available consultant managers and committed recruiters. As a consultant, you also get access to our network of exciting companies and clients! For us, it is important that you as a consultant feel comfortable, feel a sense of security and community with us as an employer. We offer an occupational pension, salary change and the option of flexpension. You also get access to our benefits portal, where in addition to wellness allowance you have access to lots of discounts and offers in wellnes, home and leisure, transport, healthcare and much more! Your well-being is of the highest priority for us, and we therefore offer you as an employee Corporate Health Care to deal with all the challenges of everyday life, both at work and in private life.

### **Salary**


As agreed.

### **Admission and Application**


Full time, office hours. Our client wishes to start 2024-11-01 and the assignment is expected to run until 2025-09-30 with possibility of extension. You will be employed by JobBusters as a consultant with our exciting client. Send in your application in English (preferably in Word format) as soon as possible, as interviews take place continuously. Application deadline is 2024-10-30.

description:

We are currently seeking a Web Editor on behalf of our client. In this role, you will work as part of the digital communications team, supporting the company's websites. Your main focus will be on managing and optimizing website content to meet business goals and improve user experience.

title: Product Owner Intern - CDI - Intern
description:
Since 2014, Wiremind has positioned itself as a **technical company** transforming the world of transport and events with a 360° approach combining **UX, software, and AI**.


Our expertise lies primarily in **optimizing and distributing** our clients' capacity. We work on various projects such as **ticket forecasting and pricing**, **3D optimization of air freight or scraping competitor prices**. Our applications are the preferred tool **of companies** such as SNCF, United Airlines, Qatar Airways or even PSG to visualize, analyze and optimize their capacity.


Dynamic and ambitious, we strive to maintain our technical DNA which is the engine of our success. The company, profitable and self-financed since its creation 10 years ago, is mainly composed **of engineers and experts** and currently supports the growth of our **business model** based on "software-as-a-service" solutions.

#### **Your missions**

**CARGOSTACK** is an end-to-end SaaS solution for airlines to manage their cargo business. It combines a Cargo Management System (CMS) with optimization modules leveraging AI models to provide forecast to support users when taking decisions such as setting the right level of capacity for sale (in kg and m3), the right price, the right overbooking level, or the best pallet build-up (think of a 3D-Tetris optimizer).

  

As a **Product Intern**, you will join a team of experienced Product Managers working all together to build the most efficient and ergonomic solution while keeping our clients at a very high level of satisfaction.


In practice – even though there is no typical day – you can expect to:

* **Take part in product delivery** by handling features backlog, write specifications
* **Realize functional tests** on each release and hotfix, coordinate with software and product teams to report potential bugs, and assist software developers to fix them
* **Help the product team** to improve the documentation of the tool
* **Analyze clients data** to better understand how the tool is used

#### **Your profile**

* You are pursuing a Master's degree in Product/Project Management or Engineering
* You are a quick learner with the ability to translate business requirements into software functionalities
* You are curious, self-motivated, and have high standards for the quality of your work
* You possess excellent interpersonal skills, enabling effective communication at all levels in both French and English
* Ideally, you have prior experience in Revenue Management or with Project/Product Management tools like Jira

#### **Our benefits**

By joining us, you will integrate:

* A self-financed startup with a strong technical identity!
* Beautiful 700 m² offices in the heart of Paris (Bd Poissonnière)
* Attractive remuneration
* A caring and stimulating team that encourages skills development through initiative and autonomy
* A learning environment with opportunities for evolution ‍


You will also benefit from:

* 1 day of remote work per week

A great company culture (monthly afterworks, regular meetings on technology and products, annual off-site seminars, team-building…)  
* 

#### **Our Recruitment Process**

* An initial discussion with our **Talent Acquisition Manager**
* A **technical test or case study** to be prepared


* A last interview at our offices to discuss your technical test or case study with the **hiring manager** and meet with members of the team



Wiremind is committed to **equality of opportunity, diversity, and fairness**. We encourage all **candidates** with the necessary experience to apply for our job offers.

title: UI/UX Artist
description:
**About us**

Coffee Stain North is a small game developer based in Stockholm that belongs to the Coffee Stain family. Since we started in 2013, we have grown to the size of 30 and are now looking for a couple of new friends!


We take pride in making games that we ourselves would like to play, a philosophy that has led us to work on multiple kinds of games in the past, like A Story About My Uncle & the Goat Simulator franchise (click here to see what Goat Enough! is)!


Working with us means working in a relaxed and friendly environment, where we value each other and the unique qualities we all bring to the table. Being small has its perks and one of our favorite is how we all have influence over our work/culture and the games we make.


Micromanaging is not our style, so you will need to take responsibility over your own work. We want everyone to feel like they’re contributing to the end product and thrive towards always becoming better at what they do.  



  

**The role**


We are looking for an experienced UI/UX artist who wants to join our team and be part of our exciting journey forward!


As our UI/UX artist you will be in charge of designing everything UI-related and creating all needed UI art assets. You will be planning and managing your own work while collaborating with Designers, Art director and UI programmers, so communication and organizational skills are essential.


We need you to be able to adapt to defined art styles (such as for our current project Goat Simulator 3) as well as develop new UI art styles from scratch for future projects.  



  

**What you will do**


* Design layouts and UI elements following usability best-practices and defined art style
* Produce UI art assets in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, XD or similar software
* Finetune implemented designs in Unreal 4’s UI tool UMG
* Work autonomously and manage your own work
* Develop UI art styles for future projects from scratch

 **Role requirements**


* Professional background in UI/UX
* Solid understanding of usability and excellent visual design skills
* Experience planning/managing your own work
* Bonus: Professional experience with UI/UX for video games
* Bonus: Experience designing UI for multi-platform products (PC, mobile, console)

As we are an organization with employees from different parts of the world, being fluent in English is a requirement.


**Perks of working at Coffee Stain North**

We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits that go beyond the usual payments to your pension fund and insurances.


* We start every Monday with breakfast together at the office and have fika together on Fridays!
* We believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind, so on top of the wellness grant you get some paid time off to work out. Did we mention there are several gyms right beside our office?
* Once a month it’s a whole day of creative Friday which lets your inner passion blossom.
* We also have fun together and get inspired by playing games together once a month on Fridays.
* We have great parental benefits, including extra pay on top of what you get from the social insurance agency during your parental leave.
* Bridge-days being paid time off.
* And, of course, you will be part of a wonderful team of colleagues working with Goat Simulator franchise and what´s next!

**Practical info**

The position is permanent, full-time, 40 hours per week. We have a hybrid setup and offer the possibility of working from home 2 days per week. Our office is newly renovated, and located in Kungsholmen, Fridhemsplan. We have, among other things, a ping-pong table, a big lounge area where we hang out, watch movies, or play games together, and last but not least – a giant goat statue (what more do you need?).


Apart from us, the Coffee Stain group consists of Coffee Stain Studios inSkövde (Sanctum and Satisfactory), Coffee Stain Malmö (working on Goat Simulator 3 mobile, among other things) and Coffee Stain Publishing who also work with close partners like Iron Gate (Valheim), Ghost Ship Games (Deep Rock Galactic), and Easy Trigger Games (Huntdown) to name a few.


**Your application**

If you are interested, please apply! We look forward to hearing from you.  

We especially encourage people of minority groups within the gaming industry to apply.

title: Engineering Manager - Customer Experience
description:
*Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.*


The Customer Experience team at Tink has a clear mission: to deliver world-class product experiences to its customers.


We provide powerful solutions to developers and their consumers. By solving the right problem, crafting a scalable solution, and providing great experiences, we make the Tink platform easy to use, quick to onboard, and we ensure reliable outcomes for the end-user. That is why front-end development and UX design are core to us at Customer Experience.


The Customer Experience area at Tink is unique with its set up of front-end and full-stack teams. With this, you will have the opportunity to not only develop the people and products we own but also how Tink as a whole work with frontend development and UX. We believe that there are a lot of things to be done and an opportunity for someone to grow within their role.


**What you will do**


Even though we have a broad mandate, there are some parts of the Tink experience we are especially passionate about. See more of the work we do and a few use cases here.


We use React, TypeScript, Golang, MySQL, node.js and all our microservices run on Kubernetes in AWS. We regularly deploy to production and assure quality by automated tests and monitoring. The team is responsible for the availability of the services it owns, has SLOs/SLIs in place as well as an on-call rotation.


Responsibilities


* Drive technical development and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment
* Build high performing teams to support a cross-functional team composed of backend and frontend engineers
* Work closely with product manager and designers to ensure we're building products in the best way
* Enable the team to reach their targets by removing impediments, clarifying goals and initiatives, and fostering ownership and accountability
* Facilitate a culture of learning, trust, responsibility, and friendliness
* Be responsible for the overall planning, execution and deliver on agreed timelines
* Make sure the team has the talent it needs to succeed long-term by hiring great people

**What we offer** **you**

Tink offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the chance to lead and shape the future of our engineering teams and be part of a mission to deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers. You will receive comprehensive support and resources to guide your engineering teams through transformations, ensuring you have everything needed when leading through change and contributing to our mission.


**What we look for**


We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has a business-oriented mindset, understands how projects and delivery influences business growth and sees the link between engineering and product development. Someone who is great at managing change and changing priorities.


* Experience from an Engineering Manager position, leading a cross-functional engineering team.
* Experience from frontend and backend engineering, we use node.js for our backend services
* A track record of operational excellence and have led a change initiative, for example taking a project or team from A to B.
* Solid experience from working in an agile development environment, preferably from a fintech/payments industry.
* Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.


*Who we are at Tink*

*We are a company of developers and engineers – it’s in our DNA to imagine, build and iterate. We were founded with a vision of transforming an industry that lacked competition and momentum. And we have built a company of passionate over-achievers who all believe there is always a better way of doing things.*

*People from all over Europe – and the world – have joined us on our mission to build the biggest and best open banking platform in Europe.*

*We're looking forward to your application!*

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Design Services, Software Development, and Manufacturing
description:

 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.

**What we offer**

* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup 💪

* Be part of a product launch 🚀



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: UX design internship
description:
**UX design internship - AI och utbildning** 




  





 Drivs du av att skapa meningsfulla digitala lösningar och vill vara med och forma framtidens utbildning? Vi söker en passionerad UX-design intern som vill arbeta med banbrytande AI-teknologi i ett startup som siktar på att göra verklig skillnad i skolvärlden. Du får gärna vara lärare i botten!
 



  





**Om rollen:** 
 Som UX-design intern kommer du att få jobba nära vårt innovativa team med två spännande AI-produkter:
 



  




* **En AI-baserad lärplattform** 
 som hjälper lärare och elever att uppnå bättre resultat genom smarta, anpassade lärlösningar.
* **En AI-utbildning** 
 som utbildar lärare och skolpersonal i att använda AI på ett effektivt sätt i klassrummet.



  





 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara att:
 


* Utveckla användarcentrerade designlösningar som förbättrar upplevelsen för våra användare.
* Genomföra användarresearch och användartester för att förstå och tillgodose behoven hos lärare och elever.
* Samarbeta tätt med vårt team av utvecklare och pedagogiska experter för att skapa produkter som verkligen gör skillnad.



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Är självgående och bekväm med att ta ägarskap över projekt.
* Har ett starkt intresse för både utbildning och teknologi.
* Är kommunikativ och trivs med att jobba i team där samarbete är centralt.
* Har erfarenhet av UX-design (en bakgrund som lärare eller erfarenhet inom utbildning är starkt meriterande).



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 



* En chans att vara en del av ett passionerat och visionärt startup-team som är dedikerat till att skapa positiv påverkan i utbildningsvärlden.
* Möjlighet att jobba med banbrytande AI-teknologi som förändrar hur utbildning bedrivs.
* Stor flexibilitet med arbete på distans och frihet att själv strukturera ditt arbete.
* En möjlighet att utvecklas inom UX och teknik i en dynamisk och snabbväxande miljö.
* Tjänsten är obetald men kan leda till en framtida anställning.



  





**Varför du kommer att älska det här:** 
 Hos oss blir du inte bara en del av ett team, du blir en del av en rörelse som tror på att utbildning kan förändra världen. Vi kombinerar teknik, pedagogik och passion för att skapa lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Om du delar vår vision och vill vara med och bygga framtidens lärande, då är detta platsen för dig!
 



  





 Låter detta som en spännande utmaning? Sök tjänsten!

title: UX Designer/Strategist
description:
Future colleague!
 



  





 In your search for the perfect company, fate has led you to 
 
 Remotion
 
 , a trailblazing Swedish consulting powerhouse. We're not your ordinary 9-to-5 establishment. Oh no, we're so much more. 
 



  





 At Remotion, we're a diverse blend of dancers, surfers, hunters, actors, football players, and baristas. But don't let our unconventional hobbies fool you. We're also a team of passionate management consultants, performance marketers, growth managers, data scientists, and creatives. Together, we possess an unwavering belief that we've unraveled the secret to driving unparalleled corporate success for companies that need to adapt to the age of digital. 
 



  





 So, if you're ready to embark on an exhilarating journey where innovation knows no bounds, join us at Remotion and become a driving force behind data-driven growth, personalized omnichannel experiences, and performance marketing excellence.
 



  





**We seek** 




 You are a dedicated UX Designer and Strategist with a passion for creating user-centric experiences. Highly organized and detail-oriented, you approach your work with creativity and an openness to new solutions and tools. Colleagues recognize your ability to translate user needs into effective design strategies and value your curiosity and problem-solving mindset.
 



  





 You have an strategic mindset and are deeply curious about human behavior and approach design with empathy and inclusivity, always seeking to understand diverse user needs. You focus on details while maintaining a holistic view of the user experience, connecting the dots to identify key challenges. You enjoy exploring user behaviour patterns, forming hypotheses, and developing creative solutions that address real problems.
 



  





 Collaboration is essential to your design process, and you excel at guiding projects from concept to execution while working closely with cross-functional teams. With proficiency in relevant design and analytic tools, you develop user-focused solutions that align seamlessly with both business goals and user needs.
 



 Your understanding of the relationship between UX and content ensures that your designs are not only functional but also engaging. Committed to quality, you consistently deliver best-in-class work that enhances user experiences and meets client objectives.
 



  





**About the position** 




 As a UX Designer and Strategist at Remotion, you will enhance our clients' user experience across web and mobile products. Your responsibilities include conducting UX audits, performing user research, and creating intuitive visual solutions. You'll collaborate closely with project managers, content strategists, designers, and developers.
 



  





 Your primary focus will be identifying user challenges and pain points to improve user satisfaction. You’ll map customer journeys, create empathy maps and personas, and analyze user behavior through tools like Hotjar and Google Analytics. Based on these insights, you’ll provide actionable recommendations for optimizing site structure and user flows, while designing wireframes and mockups in Figma or similar tools. You’ll ensure tha the design meets both user needs and business objectives an also aligned with development capabilities.
 



  





**Examples of work assignments** 



* Conduct audits of websites and apps to identify and create strategic recommendations
* Conduct user research through interviews, questionnaires, and usability tests.
* Analyze user data to make informed strategic decisions
* Define user personas and map customer journeys.
* Evaluate navigation and user flows for clarity and effectiveness.
* Create wireframes and mockups for design concepts.



  





**Your experience** 



* A degree in UX design, human-computer interaction, or a related field.
* 3 – 5 years of professional experience in UX strategy & design
* Ability to analyze user behavior and provide actionable recommendations to improve user journey.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe XD or similar to create visually compelling designs for web, mobile, and other platforms
* Experience with design systems, UI principles and best practices.
* Proficiency in Hotjar, and Google Analytics
* Experience with CMS platforms like WordPress, Optimizely, or similar systems.
* Understanding of accessibility and WCAG
* Strong problem solving skills, accuracy & strategic mindset.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Familiarity with agile working methods & project management tools such as Trello, Miro, ConceptBoard, etc.
* Integrating AI tools seamlessly into your daily workflow.
* General understanding of SEO fundamentals & tools
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English



  





**Extra plus if you...** 



* Knowledge on CSS and HTML
* General knowledge/experience in content creation
* Experience in other design tools: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, AfterEffects
* Experience on SEO Tools such as Semrush, Ahrefs, etc



  





**We offer** 



* A dynamic organization guided by agile principles, cross-functional teams, and dual leadership.
* A culture that values collective intelligence, self-leadership, and embraces diversity.
* Exciting opportunities for annual international trips, team-building conferences, and dedicated competence development days.



  





 This is a project-based position/subcontract. The role is temporary, linked to specific projects with duration and terms tailored to project needs. Ideal for those seeking flexibility and the opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects in our industry.
 



  





 In this process, we will require a strong portfolio that highlights your previous work and design solutions, showcasing your expertise. For qualified candidates moving forward, we will assign a small UX assignment/case as a part of our decision making process.
 



  





 Please note that we have a streamlined application process and kindly request that you refrain from sending applications via email. However, if you have any questions or need further information, feel free to reach out to our dedicated contact person for this recruitment process. We eagerly await your application and the chance to connect with you!
 



  





 Curious to learn more about the Remotion experience? Explore our company in more detail by visiting our website
 
 .

title: UX Writer
description:
Job Description
 
 To our client we are now looking for an UX Writer!
   





 Our client design for an array of household appliances including ovens, washing machines, humidifiers, robot vacuum cleaners, and more. They write for multiple brands within the Group portfolio and translate product copy into 45+ languages.
 



 In this role you will use copy and language to help users around the world achieve their goals, shape content strategy for future appliance UIs and connected ecosystem, collaborate with designers, researchers, creative technologists, product managers, and engineers to strengthen our client's digital product offering and help build an ambitious and supportive design culture.
 


 Qualifications
 * You have a couple of years relevant experience in UX writing and/or content strategy for digital products or services.
* You are familiar with translation and localization best practices and tools, such as Phrase and Figma.
* You have a portfolio in English that showcases a range of UX writing work and tells a story about how you think and collaborate.
* You are fluent in English in speech and writing. Proficiency in other languages is a bonus.






 Personal Qualities 
   


 To thrive in the role of UX Writer you are self-driven and organized with a proactive, collaborative approach to problem-solving. You are also an excellent communicator and are skilled at explaining to stakeholders. 
 



  




 Company Description
 
 Our client is a global leading company that manufactures household appliances to make households easier. If you want to be involved in influencing tomorrow's household appliances, then this is the client for you!
   

  




 When you join JobBusters
 
 As a consultant at JobBusters, you can feel secure with a collective agreement, available consultant managers and committed recruiters. As a consultant, you also get access to our network of exciting companies and clients! For us, it is important that you as a consultant feel comfortable, feel a sense of security and community with us as an employer. We offer an occupational pension, salary change and the option of flexpension. You also get access to our benefits portal, where in addition to wellness allowance you have access to lots of discounts and offers in wellnes, home and leisure, transport, healthcare and much more! Your well-being is of the highest priority for us, and we therefore offer you as an employee Corporate Health Care to deal with all the challenges of everyday life, both at work and in private life.
 


 Salary
 
 As agreed.
 


 Admission and Application
 
 Full time, office hours. Our client wishes to start as soon as possible and the assignment is expected to run until 2025-01-31 with possibility of extension. You will be employed by JobBusters as a consultant with our exciting client. Send in your application in English (preferably in Word format) as soon as possible, as interviews take place continuously.

title: Internship or thesis at our tech department
description:
**We are SVT's tech department**
  

  

 We develop all of SVT’s public online services – SVT Play, SVT Nyheter, SVT Sport, SVT Barn and Duo, to name a few. We are approximately 200 people, working in cross functional teams to design and develop SVT’s online services, platforms and functions. We are proud to build products that deliver news and entertainment to millions of people.
   

  

 If you're studying to become a developer, product or UX designer, QA, analyst, data engineer, or something else invaluable to creating user friendly digital products, maybe you'd like to learn together with us?
   

  

 In your application, please let us know if you have any special interest or skills that could be relevant to our work. And if you have suggestion for a thesis project, please be as specific as possible. Describe what you would like to explore, and why you want to do it!

title: UX/UI designer with coding skills!
description:
**Job Description**
**What we are looking for & our journey ahead**
 A UX/UI designer that isn't afraid to code! You want to help us on our journey to become the most user-friendly and intuitive CRM system in Europe! Lime is the market leader in the Nordics within CRM. Lime Go is a scaleup entity within Lime Group, combining speed with resources.
   

  

**What does this mean for you?**
* The first designer in the Go Team working closely with our PM and the Engineering Team
* UX/UI resources in-house (3 people working with our other product Lime CRM)
* We will have the flexibility and speed of a scaleup
* A lot of freedom and you can shape the product we build


**The team today and our method**
 We are a small, ambitious, and autonomous development team with a lot of freedom. We guarantee no code monkey business with the possibility to have a significant impact on what we develop and how we develop the product.
   

  

 Aside from the dev team, we have a fully operational sales, support, customer success & marketing organization distributing our product to new users every day .
   

  

 At Lime (like all other development companies) we work with a development process. We will not go into details in this ad, but if you are curious, do not hesitate to ask! The important part is that since we are a small team you will own what we develop and how it looks!
   

  

**Your tasks being a part of our team**
 As a Designer in the Lime Go team, you will be working on improving the UX/UI, listening closely to the users' wants and needs to determine the highest value features and workflows. Lime Go contains a lot of data, has a wide variety of customers, and supports high customizability, making it a fun, challenging and awesome product to work with. This is an objective truth.
   

  

**Skills & Requirements**
**The tech-stack**
 We have recently finished a 1,5-year FE redesign project which means you will deep dive into a completely rewritten, well-organized, and clean codebase. See pictures below to compare!
   

  

 The frontend is written with the latest versions of React and Redux with a high focus on UX/UI. Therefore, we value your skills as follows:
   

  

**Must have:**
* Javascript
* React (with hooks!)
* Design/UX/UI skills and Figma


**Nice to have:** 
 Redux or previous .NET experience
   

  

**Where?**
 The dev team is fully remote but some of us are working from our Stockholm and Lund office. All in all, we have offices in Lund, Stockholm, Gothenburg & Gävle. Not to mention Norway, Denmark, Finland, Netherlands, Germany and Poland. We do enjoy meeting physically and having discussions with a whiteboard and talking nonsense over a cup of freshly brewed Columbian coffee. You can stroll into the office you prefer! However, we are open to a hybrid/remote role if that is something you value!
   

  

**Who are we and why Lime Go?**
 Your code will affect thousands of businesses and it will help them save time through smart processes, automation and enable them to become a more efficient sales organization.
   

  

 We also have generous employee benefits such as company conferences and parties, team trips, six weeks of vacation, pension, monthly pubs, Lime Go merch (coming soon), wellness allowance etc.
   

  

 During the ride, we will have a good laugh and do a bunch of team activities. Apply now to join our journey, Europe awaits!
   

  

**The process, step by step**
 We do not have a deadline for this recruitment, but as we process applications continuously, why wait? No time like the presence. Apply now!
   

  

* First off, you will get on a screening call with a person on the team. You might also meet one or multiple members of the team.
* Then you will have an interview.
* Get a technical assignment to show off your skills.
* After that, you will have an in-depth interview.
* Finally, you get to meet our CEO (Nils) for the final interview.


 If possible, we want to combine some of the steps above into one batch, so you will become a Limer as fast as you want!
   

  

 See you soon :)
   

  

**Let’s GO!**
**Great Place to Work**
* Tight-knit team
* Collective agreement
* Startup & place to grow
* Modern UI
* Clear vision for the future
* Flexible work preferences
* Competitive salary
* International expansion
* Avg. growth 20%/year = new roles

title: Chapter Lead UX
company_industry: Insurance and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Are you our next UX Chapter Lead, ready to support and grow a talented team of UX Designers while also contributing to UX deliveries and shaping meaningful design solutions?**
 Insurance is about supporting people through life’s unexpected moments, giving them the confindence to live their life to the fullest. We’ve formed a community of designers and researchers to ensure customer insights shape our products and services, where it’s all about creating helpful and accessible experiences. And it’s all about UX.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Chapter Lead for the Swedish UX team, you will be leading a friendly and talented group of UX Designers in placed in our offices in Bergshamra and Mölndal. In this role you will have the opportunity to balance leadership with hands-on design, also working in a cross-functional delivery team. In your work team, you will be driving UX design processes including user research, prototyping, usability testing, and working with our design system, ensuring we deliver on our customer promise of being the most caring insurance company.
   

  

 In your role as Chapter Lead, you will foster a collaborative and supportive environment where team members can turn for sparring, sharing, and continuous learning. Your leadership will focus on competence development and nurturing a culture of feedback, encouraging personal and professional growth. Your role includes conducting development dialogues, compensation reviews, and recruitment.
   

  

 As you will lead a competence chapter in a scaled agile context, with UX Designers supporting different deliveries in the organization, you will work closely with various stakeholders to understand their needs and ensuring the right level of design support.
   

  

**We offer**
 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.
   

  

 Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch benefit
* High pension savings


**About The Team**
 The Swedish UX Chapter is one out of four competence teams within the UX & Service Design unit you where you will be the direct manager of 10 UX Designers. In your role as Chapter Lead UX, you will report to the Head of UX & Service Design, and work closely with other design Chapter Leads, competence area Leads, and the Design System team. You'll be part of a broad, skilled, and friendly community of over 60 designers, researchers and accessibility specialists, that together design digital services and touchpoints for If customers, covering the entire customer journey—from learning about and purchasing insurance to onboarding, being insured, and helping customers recover from accidents or loss. At If, we believe the best way to grow and improve is through collaboration, making knowledge-sharing the backbone of our Experience Design Community.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We are looking for a dedicated leader with a strong foundation in UX Design and design thinking methodologies. Your focus is on promoting the well-being and development of your team, fostering a collaborative environment where they can thrive. You are passionate about people, committed to their professional growth, and create a culture that prioritizes sharing and collaboration. You bring a good portion of UX expertise and skills to the chapter and into your work team. You lead with empathy, understanding, and support—empowering others to grow and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
   

  

**You also have:**
* 7+ years of relevant experience in UX Design, with deep expertise in design thinking methodologies.
* Proven leadership experience, with a focus on empowering and developing teams.
* Formal education in Design, Psychology, Anthropology, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
* Skilled in working with Figma design libraries and experienced in implementing design systems.
* Good understanding of accessibility principles and experience in designing inclusive, accessible user experiences.
* Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and execute complex projects/design needs while ensuring high-quality outcomes.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, with experience collaborating with a wide variety of stakeholders across functions and levels.
* Understanding of business needs, with the ability to translate them into concrete requirements and effective design solutions.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* A passion for fostering a culture of well-being, professional development, and continuous learning.


**Additional facts and the recruitment process:**
**Application deadline:** 
 3rd of November 2024, but screening and interviewing will start immediately.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV and an application letter in English. Additionally, a link to your portfolio or samples of your work are highly appreciated.
   

**Work location:** 
 Bergshamra
   

  

**Traveling:** 
 Several times a year in the Nordic and Baltic countries
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible/by agreement
   

  

 For more information, please contact Ida Sundborg, Head of UX & Service Design by dropping an email to ida.sundborg@if.se
   

  

  

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Web Editor to consulting assignment
description:
We are seeking an experienced and communicative Web Editor for an exciting consulting assignment within the manufacturing industry, based in Malmö, Sweden. The assignment runs from November 1, 2024, to September 30, 2025, with 100% on-site work required.
 



**About the Role** 




 As a Web Editor, you will join the company’s digital communications team, which is part of Corporate Communications. Your primary responsibility will be to publish, update, and enhance website content, while also leading initiatives to optimize and develop the site’s user experience. This role involves analyzing website data and collaborating with internal stakeholders to ensure the website effectively supports business goals.
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Publish and maintain content on the company’s CMS platforms (Sitecore, Umbraco, and WordPress)
* Initiate and coordinate improvement activities for the website
* Conduct web data analysis (GA4, Crazy Egg) and apply SEO optimization to enhance visibility and usability
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure content and functionality meet set objectives
* Coordinate projects and participate in planning for website development
* Implement UX improvements to maximize user experience



**About You** 




 We are looking for a self-driven and proactive individual with a keen eye for detail and a natural ability to collaborate. You thrive at the intersection of IT and communication and have experience working in complex business environments where IT systems are integrated.
 



**Experience and Skills** 



* Solid experience as a Web Editor or similar role, preferably within larger organizations
* Strong knowledge of CMS systems, such as Sitecore, Umbraco, and WordPress
* Experience in data analysis, SEO, and UX design
* Background in project planning and coordination
* Fluency in English; Swedish is a plus
* Experience with tools like GA4 and Crazy Egg is a bonus



**About the Assignment**
 For this assignment, you will be employed as a consultant at Digitalenta. We offer all our consultants a comprehensive wellness allowance, insurance coverage, favorable pension savings, regular consultant gatherings, and, of course, a dedicated consultant manager who will be available to support you throughout your employment.

title: iOS Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking audio innovation. We are home to Marshall, Natal Drums, Urbanears and adidas headphones.
   

  

 For over sixty years, we’ve amplified the sound of the world’s most talented artists. We’ve brought their music to crowds and solo listeners everywhere. We give sound a design that resonates with ears and eyes, as well as at a deeper cultural level. No matter the scene or music genre, we aim to excite, intrigue and surprise.
   

  

 Bridging iconic rock ‘n’ roll heritage with cutting-edge innovation and culture-driven brand-building, our group activities span professional music equipment, consumer electronics, live events, a record label, and more.
   

  

 We empower around 800 highly talented people across 8 global locations. Our products are sold in over 90 markets worldwide, totalling a combined annual turnover of USD 360 million.
   

  

***Right now,***
 we need to strengthen our Application Development team with an iOS developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Maintain and develop iOS mobile apps for the Marshall Brand.
* Contribute to the design and implemention of a scalable solution for our new iOS platform.
* Collaborate closely with our UX and firmware teams in developing and implementing our new features and functions.
* Support and participate in the testing and evaluation of the app's integration with the firmware.
* Drive knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Define processes and frameworks for our newly established team.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for an experienced iOS developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be a committed driver with a problem-solving approach, focused on building quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, new trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You Probably Have The Following Experiences & Skills**
* 5+ years experience in iOS app development
* Experience working with Swift, Swift UI and Swift package manager.
* Proficient in modern iOS design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection)
* Strong understanding of the Combine framework
* Familiarity interacting with Firebase and Clean Architecture
* Good understanding of the developer testing infrastructure (Unit testing, UI tests, Jenkins, etc.)


 It's beneficial if you understand the Bluetooth stack, communication over GATT and AVKit; and WiFi stack.
   

  

 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, and it will in the end lead to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 If you have a passion for App development and want to work for a growing company with a start-up mindset, this job is a perfect match for you. Please send us your resume as soon as possible as we are reviewing candidates continuously.
   

  

*We look forward to reviewing your application!*

title: Senior UX writer
company_industry: Advertising Services, Market Research, and Public Relations and Communications Services
description:
As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, our client is gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. Ready for a fantastic journey?
   

  

**Period for assignment** 
 Oct 2024 - Feb 2025
   

  

 During the period you will be employed by Jefferson Wells.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

 Our client design for an array of household appliances including ovens, washing machines, humidifiers, robot vacuum cleaners, and more. You will write for multiple brands within the Group portfolio and translate product copy into 45+ languages.
   

  

* Use copy and language to help users around the world achieve their goals
* Shape content strategy for our future appliance UIs and connected ecosystem
* Collaborate with designers, researchers, creative technologists, product managers, and engineers to strengthen Electrolux Group's digital product offering
* Help build an ambitious and supportive design culture


**In detail, you will**
* Write clear, inclusive, accessible product copy for the end-to-end user experience, including onboarding, instructional flows, error messages, over-the-air updates, and more
* Initiate, define, and design a data-informed content approach for new products and features
* Partner with our global translation and localization team to ensure copy scales globally
* Work with product and marketing teams to name new features and instil a unified voice across product platforms
* Contribute to our design system, regularly adding to and editing our global glossary and creating UX writing guidelines as needed
* Be a part of growing UX writing team. You'll share ideas and take initiative to shape ways of working and best practices in our discipline and content community


 Who you are
   

  

* You have 5+ years relevant experience in UX writing and/or content strategy for digital products or services
* You're familiar with translation and localization best practices and tools, such as Phrase and Figma
* You're self-driven and organized with a proactive, collaborative approach to problem-solving
* You're an excellent communicator who articulates the rationale for your work and illustrates how it aligns with customer needs and business goals
* You're a champion for UX writing, skilled at explaining what it is and why it matters to cross-functional stakeholders
* You're fluent in English with an attention to detail with spelling and grammar, proficiency in other languages is a bonus
* You have a portfolio in English that showcases a range of UX writing work and tells a story about how you think and collaborate


**You demonstrate**
* Collaboration- contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish
* Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis
* Empathy - can understand and acknowledge the emotions and perspectives of others during conversations
* Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.
* Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach
* Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback
* Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynami


**Where you'll be**
* This is a full-time position, based at our clients Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden).
* There are 60+ nationalities under the same roof who enjoy the look and feel of the office!
* You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.


**About Jefferson Wells**
 Jefferson Wells is a consulting and recruitment company specializing in the provision of skilled managers and specialists. Jefferson Wells' unique expertise and industry experience enable us to help businesses grow and provide long-term career development for our candidates. Jefferson Wells operates in about 50 locations across Sweden and in more than 50 countries worldwide, and is part of ManpowerGroup. With our extensive network, we can offer numerous exciting job opportunities.
   

  

**How to Apply** 
 To apply for the position, click on "Apply Now" and create an account with us. Please note that we do not accept applications via email. We work with ongoing selection and look forward to receiving your application soon. Warm welcome to your application!

title: Product Manager - Beslutsstöd
company_industry: Financial Services, Software Development, and Banking
description:
*Vi på Avanza genomgår just nu en fantastisk tillväxtresa, vi har både utökat vårt erbjudande samt antalet kunder och med det har vi en stor bredd av kunder på vår plattform som behöver stöd och hjälp. Vi ser ett stort behov av att göra det enklare för såväl nybörjare som proffs att enkelt få den information de behöver och bli guidade till rätt investeringsbeslut.* 




  










*För att fortsätta utmana och göra det ännu enklare för fler att handla aktier och samtidigt ge våra mer avancerade kunder ännu kraftfullare investeringsverktyg har vi ett team som ansvarar för beslutsstöd för börshandlade produkter och till det teamet söker vi nu en Product Manager, är det du?* 




  





  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Product Manager leder du ett agilt utvecklingsteam tillsammans med front- och backendutvecklare samt UX designers och tillsammans ansvarar ni för att se till så att kunderna har de beslutsstöd de behöver för att fatta sina investeringsbeslut.
 



  





 Du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt tillsammans med ditt team skapar du mål och roadmap för att konkretisera visionen, prioritera och förverkliga den samt följa upp resultaten. Du jobbar aktivt med omvärlds- och konkurrensbevakning och tillgängliggör dessa observationer så att teamet kan ta action. Ditt bidrag leder till att vi lyfter blicken och innoverar samtidigt som vi kontinuerligt förbättrar våra tjänster och effektiviserar där det behövs.
 



  





  





**Några av dina ansvarsområden kommer att vara:** 



* Ansvara för produktutvecklingen genom att säkerställa att teamet bygger rätt produkter för att förverkliga produktvision och mission.
* Ansvara för att säkerställa att våra kunder får det bästa stödet i sina investeringsbeslut.
* Ansvara för dialogen med interna och externa intressenter/stakeholders till produkten
* Ansvara för att definiera mål och följa upp KPI:er för teamets område
* Identifiera kritiska risker och säkerställa regelefterlevnad
* Tillsammans med övriga ledare inom Handla bidra till våra gemensamma mål och vision och säkerställa att vi har den bästa upplevelsen för investeringar i värdepapper.



  





 Du kommer att ingå i arean Handla som ansvarar för investeringsupplevelsen på Avanza och ingå i en grupp av Product Managers som jobbar tillsammans inom arean, du rapporterar till areans Head of Product.
 



  





  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi söker dig med en passion för aktie- och börshandel, som är skicklig inom produktutveckling och van att arbeta hypotesdrivet för att ta små steg i rätt riktning. Du har kundens främsta som utgångspunkt i allt du gör och vill skapa en knivskarp digital användarupplevelse genom att göra det svåra enkelt.
 



  





 För att lyckas i den här rollen har du ett personligt engagemang, empati med kunderna och en genuin vilja att hjälpa dem att lyckas ännu bättre med sina investeringar. Du har lätt för att bygga relationer samtidigt som du har en förmåga att driva initiativ framåt och vågar testa för att lära snabbt.
 



  





**Ansökan:** 




 Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den
 **10 November** 
 . Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*
