title: Software Development Engineer
description:
Job Title
Software Development Engineer
Job Description*Now you have the chance to work as a Software Development Engineer in a friendly team consisting of skilled cloud developers working with cutting edge cloud technology.*
Who is your future team?
You will be part of the Connected Infrastructure team within R&D. This team develops and operates core functionality in the Axis Cloud Connect platform.
What you’ll do here as Software Development Engineer?
You will be building (The Dev-part) services that make up the core features of Axis Cloud Connect and together with the rest of your team operate (The Ops-part) these. The tools at your disposal will be GitHub, AWS, OpsGenie, DataDog, Jira, to name a few. You will write the services primarily in Go, but sometimes we use other languages such as TypeScript.
In this role you will get a unique possibility to work with very skilled cloud developers that are building a platform that enhances the security, feature set and operational efficiency of Axis world leading network products.
Who are you?
We are looking for an open-minded, motivated individual who genuinely enjoys working with others and values collaboration. You have an enthusiastic DevOps approach and enjoy the challenge of building robust cloud services capable of handling high loads. You embrace the responsibility that comes with operating and hosting the solutions you create
We'd love to hear that you have/are:* A few years of experience building cloud services in Amazon Web Services
* Fluent in any modern backend language, preferably Go or TypeScript
* Like working in an agile environment


What Axis have to offer
By joining Axis, you will embark on an exciting journey of personal and professional growth. We will offer you a great introduction to Axis with training and a personal mentor. Our team will support you, but also listen to your experiences and give you freedom to explore and realize your ideas. We are a fast-growing company that can offer you great career opportunities and a competitive package of benefits.
In exchange for your dedication, Axis offers you a job in an open, friendly, and professional environment. We work in an innovative and global organization that takes great pride in delivering world-class, high-quality products, services, and solutions to our customers. Working with us gives you an excellent opportunity to develop in an organization promoting professional and individual growth. You will have a role where your operational effort really will be of great impact to the overall success of Axis.
We want you to enjoy working with us, which is why we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning “fika” every day, Friday cake, company bonus, wellness allowance, health insurance and your very own Axis bicycle - to name a few.  

  

We also provide a brand new training facility free for every Axis employee.
You can see it here Axis HQ  

We believe in sustainability, equality and inclusion
Read more here  

Axis is an organization that values creativity and promotes teamwork and openness. With us you will grow both personally and professionally. You will be part of a team of great colleagues that enjoy going to work in the morning. Welcome!
Curious to discover more?  

We have a host of places where you can learn more about Axis, our products, solutions, company culture, and what working at Axis is really like.  

  

Check out:
Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.  

If you have any questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Jon Lindeheim at +46 73 323 0906.*This recruitment is handled solely by Axis Communications AB, and we politely but firmly decline all calls from recruitment and consulting companies regarding this position.*
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2024-11-22*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: DevOps Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Looking to revolutionize the intersection of development and operations in a fast paced tech company? Join us in reshaping the technological landscape as a DevOps Engineer. Dive into dynamic challenges, collaborate with top-tier talents, and drive innovation in a supportive, forward-thinking environment. As a DevOps Engineer, you'll dive into exciting challenges and work together with several software teams across the world to provide the best software infrastructure.
  
  

**About Us:**  

At Mycronic we are on the cutting edge of software development, working with one of the most advanced products in the industry. Our collaborative team of experienced developers embraces an open mindset, working together to solve challenges and push the boundaries of what's possible. We foster innovation, encouraging development and exploring new paths to problem-solving. Join us, and you'll be part of a dynamic environment where you're challenged to enhance quality and contribute innovative solutions.
  
  

**Role Overview:**  

We are currently seeking a skilled DevOps Infrastructure Engineer to serve as an admin and power user for our suite of infrastructure tools, including but not limited to Gitlab, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Docker, WMWare, Cloud Azure, and Black Duck. As an expert in these tools, you will play a crucial role in supporting the software lifecycle, from development to deployment. This position requires programming knowledge to work with and maintain these tools, along with the ability to develop new tools and scripts for automation.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Administer and manage infrastructure tools such as Gitlab, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Docker, WMWare, Cloud Azure, and Black Duck.
  
Support the software lifecycle from development to deployment.
  
Develop and maintain scripts and tools for automation.
  
Work independently and take ownership of projects.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure operational efficiency.
  
Test and evaluate new tools and methods for effective software development.
  
Provide support for infrastructure observability.
  
Promote automated software testing and continuous integration.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
  
Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
  
Detail-oriented with a commitment to producing high-quality software solutions.
  
Adaptable and open to learning new technologies and tools.
  
Strong communication skills for effective collaboration with teams, developers, and stakeholders.
  
Enjoy sharing knowledge and supporting team members.
  
  

**Experience:**  

At least 3-10 years of relevant work experience.
  
Experience working in an Agile environment.
  
Administration of Linux environments in a corporate setting.
  
Containerization technologies and orchestration experience.
  
Strong scripting skills in Python and Bash.
  
Infrastructure as code experience.
  
Administration of code repository and continuous integration servers.
  
Familiarity with system architectures, basic network, and storage experience.
  
Familiarity with Azure Tenant administration.
  
Familiarity with software composition analysis and license compliance.
  
  

**Mandatory Knowledge:**  

Gitlab
  
Python
  
Bash
  
Debian/Ubuntu Linux
  
Docker
  
Kubernetes
  
  

**Meriting Knowledge:**  

Artifactory
  
Black Duck
  
VMware vSphere
  
Prometheus
  
Grafana
  
Loki
  
Ansible
  
Powershell
  
  

**Start Date:** ASAP
  
**Open positions:** 1 developer
  
**Office Presence:** Mandatory at least 60% in the Täby office.
  
Join us in shaping the future of software development and making remarkable things happen! If you're passionate about DevOps and possess the skills we're looking for, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Senior Azure Administrator
description:
**Avigna is hiring for Senior Azure Administrator**


Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for a Senior Azure Administrator to join the team to build, support and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule.


In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

**Job Title:** Senior Azure Administrator  

**Location:** Flexible (Fully Remote) – Must be available to work in the Sweden time zone

### **Job Overview:**


Avigna is seeking an experienced **Senior Azure Administrator** to manage and optimize our Azure cloud infrastructure. This role involves provisioning cloud resources, ensuring security, and automating deployments. The successful candidate will have a solid background in **Azure Infrastructure**, **AKS administration**, and **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** with tools like **Terraform** and **Ansible**. You will also be responsible for conducting security assessments, implementing CI/CD pipelines, and helping stakeholders migrate workloads to a new enterprise-scale environment.

### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Provision, manage, and optimize **Azure cloud infrastructure**.
* Deploy cloud resources using **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** tools such as **Terraform** and **Ansible**.
* Administer **Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)**, managing networking, security, policy, and automation.
* Set up and manage **CI/CD pipelines** using **GitHub Actions** and **Azure DevOps**.
* Perform regular security assessments of cloud resources, identifying vulnerabilities, and taking initiatives to improve the security posture.
* Implement and manage **HashiCorp Vault** or similar tools for enhanced security (preferred).
* Collaborate with stakeholders to migrate workloads to a new **Enterprise Scale environment**.
* Drive initiatives to optimize costs and improve operational efficiency.
* Configure and manage **security policies** across the cloud infrastructure.
* Share knowledge with the team and stakeholders through knowledge transfer sessions.

### **Technical Skills & Expertise:**

* **Azure Cloud Infrastructure**: Proven hands-on experience managing complex cloud environments.
* **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)**: Proficient in **Terraform** and **Ansible** for deploying cloud resources.
* **CI/CD Pipelines**: Experience with **Azure DevOps** and **GitHub Actions** for automation.
* **AKS Administration**: Expertise in managing Azure Kubernetes Services, including networking, security, and policy automation.
* **Security Assessments**: Ability to identify potential threats and improve the security of cloud infrastructure.
* **HashiCorp Vault**: Experience with Vault or similar tools is a plus.
* **Azure Certifications**: Must be **AZ-104 certified**. **AZ-500** and **AZ-700** certifications are highly desirable.

### **Qualifications:**

* **4+ years of experience** in **Azure cloud administration**.
* **7+ years of experience** managing overall IT infrastructure.
* **2+ years of experience** implementing **IaC**, **Kubernetes**, and **CI/CD pipelines**.
* **AZ-104 certification** required; **AZ-500** and **AZ-700** certifications are a plus.

### **Desired Characteristics:**

* Strong passion for continuous learning and development of cloud/DevOps skills.
* Demonstrated ability to take initiative and drive projects to completion.
* Experience working in **Agile** and **DevOps environments**.
* Strong team player, comfortable conducting knowledge transfer sessions and collaborating with stakeholders.
* Ability to manage and optimize **complex cloud infrastructure**.

title: Cloud DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you an experienced Cloud Infrastructure Engineer that is deeply into DevOps and wants to be at the forefront of the Telco cloud evolution?
   

  

 I am Thomas Mårtensson, and I am leading the development and operations of Telia's network cloud platform. Right now, we are looking for an experienced Cloud DevOps Engineer to our NFVI-team to further increase our ability to maintain and evolve the network cloud platform.
   

  

**As a Cloud DevOps Engineer** 
 you will continue to evolve our network cloud platform and do this by using the latest technologies in the area. You will be part of an agile team that are responsible for Lifecycle Management (LCM), Change Management, Incident Management, and automation of the infrastructure.
   

  

 The team works currently according to Agile and SAFe ways-of-working and are looking to adapt SRE practices/principles going forward.
   

  

 The work duties consist of but are not limited to:
   

  

* Service Assurance on the platform with on call duty
* Contributing to System LCM & development roadmaps.
* Management of SW & HW upgrade planning.
* Automate the platform operations with DevOps and SRE principles


**Who We're Looking For**
 We think that you have a passion for automation and are inspired by new challenges and driving for an improved tomorrow. You take the initiative and have a flexible can-do attitude, as well as self-development capability to follow the industry treads and drive change. You bring a genuine interest of mentoring and sharing knowledge with the team.
   

  

 Your experience:
   

  

* Solid understanding of private cloud technologies and processes, as well virtual machines, and servers (VMware: SAN, vSPhare, vROPs, NSX).
* Troubleshooting experience of both software and hardware.
* Experienced in coordinating and planning LCM activities based on vendor recommendation.
* Experienced in utilizing Infrastructure as Code (IAAS) to automate operations (Ansible, Jenkins, OpenStack, Saltstack, Terraform, CloudFormation etc.).
* Configuration management principles and tools (Git, Gerrit, Bitbucket).
* CI/CD, testing and test case development.


**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 18,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2024-11-24. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our (Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner). Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at thomas.x.martensson@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together**

title: Data Engineer - AWS, Redshift, Python & SQL
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on mobile phones. We facilitate over 147 billion conversations annually, reaching every phone on Earth. Our technology powers the world's leading communication platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Data Engineer to collaborate on our data pipeline and data warehousing solutions.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from our Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain scalable, resilient data pipelines using AWS services such as Lambda, Step Functions, Redshift, and S3.
* Improve and maintain the Redshift data warehouse solution.
* Manage the data lifecycle from ingestion and processing to storage and retrieval.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, with a primary focus on Python and SQL.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our data processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with data scientists, software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional data solutions.
* Build and maintain visualizations and dashboards in Tableau.


**Requirements**
* Capable of developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
* Experienced professional in team-based software development and deployment.
* Skilled in using SQL for data querying and ETL/ELT development.
* Experienced in data warehousing (Redshift) and data modelling.
* In-depth knowledge of AWS services including Lambda, Step Functions, Redshift, and S3.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and efficient code.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, data engineering, or related technical discipline.


 Good to have
   

  

* Knowledgeable about various data architectures such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric.
* Experience in data visualization tools.
* Knowledge in or willing to learn infrastructure as code using Terraform.
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow engineers, empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!

title: TECH LEAD - Dubai, UAE
description:
**Employment Type:** 
 Full-time & Permanent
   

  

**Salary:** 
 USD
 **100,000 - 140,000** 
**per annum** 
 in a zero-tax environment (plus annual performance-based bonuses)
   

  

**Job Location:** 
 Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship & relocation assistance)
   

  

**About Cobblestone Energy**
 Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the European Gas and Power markets. Established in 2017, we are shaping the future of global commodity trading with a focus on deep analytics and technological innovation. Our success is driven by our people, whom we back with real responsibility from the start. At Cobblestone Energy, excellence is valued and extraordinary talent from around the world is welcomed. Our flat organisational structure encourages a culture of innovation, granting team members autonomy and ownership of their work.
   

  

**Cobblestone Values**
* Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
* Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
* The team is more important than the individual.
* Being the best in any market we enter
* Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
* Others must benefit from our existence.


**Job Description**
 At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European power and gas trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. Being a Tech Lead in our team, you will lead our team's work on the exciting challenges that come with large-scale data processing, automation, and analytics. We work in an agile and highly collaborative environment and challenge the norms of traditional business leadership. We are looking for enthusiastic and experienced individuals who are able to lead tech projects and own the development of the team as a whole.
   

  

 This is a rare opportunity to take a leading role in the growth of a major player in the European Power and Gas Markets. We are looking for someone who would be committed to the long-term success of the business. We operate in the European Power and Gas markets & expanding into more Markets, but our commercial trading operations are in Dubai, UAE.
   

  

 If you have excellent programming skills, a passion for developing/improving applications utilising cutting edge technologies, and strong leadership skills, then we would like to meet you.
   

  

**What we offer in this role**
* A full-time position on our Tech team
* Committed and remarkably talented colleagues
* Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance
* An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career
* An opportunity to work on new things from scratch and make independent decisions
* Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business
* Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term


**Responsibilities**
* Take full ownership of all project stages from business requirements gathering to product delivery
* Responsible for end-to-end planning of the project including resources, sprints, milestones, timeline, and deadlines
* Take the initiative to report and resolve any bottlenecks or issues related to the projects & members they are managing autonomously
* Substantial contribution in design & architecture of our apps ensuring the design is scalable, optimized and HA.
* Own and shape our best practices & processes and improve/optimize them to ensure they are up to standards
* Own the technical implementation of the project they are handling and ensure it's robust and optimized.
* Mentor & Coach Junior team members and their project colleagues


**Requirements**
* BS degree in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Electrical Engineering. Masters is a plus
* 4+ years of work experience in Python (Java work experience is a plus)
* 2+ years of work experience leading other developers.
* 1+ years of experience developing API services
* Work experience in Cloud resources/ services (AWS is a plus)
* Work experience in non-relational databases
* Strong design & coding skills with proven competency in architecture, data structures, and algorithms
* Strong work experience in Relational Databases including PostgreSQL


**Desirable Skills/Experience**
* Experience in Algo trading and Automated trading is a big plus.
* Processing, storing, and managing Real-time data of large volume is a big plus
* Strong knowledge in DevOps, CI/CD, Docker containers
* Experience managing multiple projects at the same time

title: Lead QA Automation Engineer
description:
**Who we are:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, the UK, China and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
   

  

**About the Job:**
 We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced
 **QA Automation Engineer** 
 to join our R&D department in Stockholm:
   

  

 In this position, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality of our Software products involving shared components and services among different software products. You will be working as part of the Stockholm R&D department, where you will work and collaborate with different software engineering teams. We believe that you are a team player, likes to coach and mentor colleagues for best practices. You are self driven and are able to work independently with minimal oversight.
   

  

 This position will be focused primarily on working with desktop applications running on Windows/iOS platform and will involve designing and implementing quality assurance practices for our current and future products.
   

  

**The role includes:**
* Defining and deploying Test Strategy for our software applications considering all shared services, components, devices and platforms.
* Writing end to end automation test cases for software products.
* Execution of regression testing, integration testing, performance testing and other non-functional testing as part of software delivery and release.
* Making sure that products of exceptional quality are delivered, aligned with business objectives and with agreed design guidelines.
* Collaborating and working closely with product development teams and coaching them to ensure quality of their solutions.
* Helping teams to automate their new and existing test procedures.
* Participating in the agile development process.


**We are looking for someone with:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer/Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
* 7+ years’ experience in Quality Assurance and Software Testing
* Strong knowledge of Software Quality Assurance best practices and methodologies
* Experience in QA Automation
* Believes in continuous improvement and taking initiatives for value creation
* Agile mindset and experience working with DevOps (CI/CD) practices
* Good organizational and team player skills
* Good English communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience working with tools and frameworks like Selenium, Cucumber, NUnit, Playwright, Jest is a bonus
* Experience working with Azure DevOps build and release pipelines is a bonus
* Experience using a test management system, preferably TestRail is bonus
* Experience working with version control systems, such as Git is preferred.
* Experience working with Alternative and Augmentative communication (AAC) domain is a bonus


**Next step:**
 Please address your questions to Mine Hacisalihoglu (mine.hacisalihoglu@tobiidynavox.com) and submit your resume (only in English) or LinkedIn profile through our website. We're looking forward to your application!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Solutions Architect, ISV
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about guiding top software companies in the Nordics and Baltics in their global innovation and acceleration? Do you want to help our customers adopt agile operation models, build modern SaaS architectures, and help them be at the forefront of their Generative AI transformation?
   

  

 As a Solutions Architect at AWS, you’ll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 We're also open to hire for the position in Helsinki, Oslo and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 You will manage the overall technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their challenging projects.
   

  

**You Will Also**
* Educate customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
* You will build the technical relationship with customers and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
* Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features
* You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. whitepapers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
* Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organization by hiring, coaching and mentoring others.
* Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes.


 If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible,
   

  

 come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The AWS ISV Solutions Architecture team is dedicated to working with software companies. We’re here to help customers to design and build some of the most scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures and solutions – cost efficiently to enable them to expand their business globally.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 The ISV Solutions Architect team is part of the global Sales, Marketing and Global Services (SMGS) AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) which is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience and familiarity with software companies.
* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content
* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures.
* Experience working in a customer-facing role


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2741382

title: Junior Teknisk Projektledare
description:
Vi söker dig som är 1-3 år in i karriären och vill växa in i rollen som teknisk projektledare . Du kommer få chansen att lära dig mycket på kort tid, ta eget ansvar och utveckla både dina tekniska och ledarskapsförmågor.
   

  

**Vad Vi Söker**
* Utbildning inom IT, systemvetenskap eller liknande tekniskt område
* 1-3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta i IT-projekt, gärna med inriktning mot applikationsutveckling och förvaltning
* Grundläggande kunskap om agila metoder som Scrum
* Kompetens inom kodning och skriptning (främst Python och PowerShell)
* Intresse för att koordinera tekniska uppgifter
* Förståelse för grunderna i mjukvaruutveckling, databaser och IT-infrastruktur
* Erfarenhet av teknisk support, test, felsökning och kvalitetssäkring
* Noggrannhet och vana vid att dokumentera arbetsprocesser
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande Kunskaper**
* Erfarenhet av webbaserade applikationer och tjänster
* Kännedom om DevOps-principer
* Intresse för dataanalys och statistik
* Insikt i principer för systemarkitektur och design


**Som Konsult Hos Liminity Får Du**
* Spännande uppdrag hos olika kunder där du kan utveckla dina färdigheter
* Utbildningsmöjligheter inom projektledning och IT
* Flexibla arbetstider med möjlighet till visst distansarbete
* Konkurrenskraftig ingångslön med utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Tillgång till vårt breda nätverk av erfarna konsulter
* Och mycket mer! Läs mer på https://handbok.liminity.se/

title: Lead Enterprise Architect
description:
TRATON Financial Services (TFS) is here to make sustainable transportation a reality!
   

  

 We are a newly established group-wide financial services unit within the TRATON Group building on Scania Financial Services. The corporate group includes Scania, MAN, Navistar, and Volkswagen Truck & Bus LLC, among others.
   

  

 With a presence in over 65 markets, we are already one of the most global private actors in the financial services industry.
   

  

 As the Lead Enterprise Architect, you will play a crucial role in aligning IT capabilities with business objectives across the organization’s global operations. You will be responsible for the Architecture-function as well as the implementation of the Enterprise Architecture across the organisation. This strategic role involves close collaboration with business units (BUs).
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop & Implement Target Enterprise Architecture: Maintain, enhance and implement a comprehensive architecture across the Group aligned with business goals and IT initiatives, ensuring scalability and adaptability.
* Mentorship and Team Leadership: Lead and mentor the architecture team, fostering professional development and improving architecture practices.
* Align IT and Business Objectives: Ensure that architectural frameworks support and enable the business strategy to achieve desired outcomes.
* Technology Roadmap Management: Develop and manage the technology roadmap, ensuring the adoption of emerging, scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions.
* Governance and Standards Oversight: Establish and enforce architecture governance, standards, and best practices across the organization for consistency and efficiency.
* System Integration Patterns: Oversee complex system integration projects, ensuring that new and existing systems work seamlessly together.
* Technology Risk Management: Identify, assess, and mitigate risks related to technology and architecture, ensuring security and regulatory compliance.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with senior executives, business leaders, and IT teams to understand needs and deliver solutions that drive growth and efficiency.
* Support Digital Transformation: Lead architecture efforts for digital transformation, focusing on cloud-based and agile technologies.


**Qualifications:**
* Enterprise Architecture Expertise: 10+ years of experience in enterprise architecture, with a strong focus on the financial services sector.
* Solution architecture Expertise: 10+ years of experience in solution architecture in design and improving global, multi-entity, multi-brand secure architecture spanning across multiple systems and platforms.
* Financial Services Technology Knowledge: Expertise in core banking systems, payment platforms, risk management, and digital banking, along with familiarity with regulatory challenges.
* Proficiency in Cloud, Data, and AI: Strong knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), data architecture, analytics, and AI/ML technologies, with a focus on security and compliance.
* Leadership and Stakeholder Management: Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams, influence key decisions, and manage enterprise-level projects.
* Regulatory and Compliance Knowledge: In-depth understanding of financial regulations (e.g., GDPR, Basel III, PCI-DSS) and experience implementing compliant technology solutions.
* Risk Management and Cybersecurity Expertise: Experience in risk assessment, developing secure architectures, and implementing robust cybersecurity measures.
* Agile and Digital Transformation Experience: Hands-on experience in driving digital transformation using agile methodologies and modern DevOps practices.


**Who are you as a person?**
* Strategic Thinker: Able to develop and articulate long-term architectural strategies aligned with business goals.
* Analytical Mindset: Skilled in analyzing complex issues, making data-driven decisions, and solving intricate architectural problems.
* Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead, inspire, and motivate teams while fostering talent development.
* Detail-Oriented: Capable of managing intricate architectural frameworks and compliance requirements with precision.
* Proactive and Initiative-Taking: Able to anticipate challenges and implement solutions proactively.
* Adaptable: Comfortable navigating and embracing changes in the evolving IT landscape.
* Effective Communicator: Excellent communication skills for collaborating across functions and explaining complex topics to non-technical stakeholders.
* Resilient: Ability to handle pressure and setbacks while maintaining focus and productivity.
* Ethical and Trustworthy: High ethical standards in managing sensitive information and decision-making.
* Collaborative: A strong team player, able to foster a cooperative and productive work environment across departments and with external partners.


**For more information please contact:**
 Johan Kjörning – johan.kjorning@tratonfs.com
   

  

**Application**
 Join us in driving IT excellence ensuring that our business is proposerous. We look forward to receiving your application, including CV, cover letter and diploma, by 31st of October.

title: R&D Software Manager – Medtech
description:
**R&D Software Manager – Technology and Innovation**
 Are you a skilled software professional with a passion for leading innovative R&D teams? Are you seeking a role where you can drive advanced software projects while staying involved with the technology? We are looking for a talented Software Manager to join forces with our lead software architect and our expanding team.
   

  

**About Us**
 We are an international tech-driven company headquartered in Sweden, currently in a growth phase, with additional offices in North America and Northern Europe. Our mission is to revolutionize rapid detection technologies, providing new solutions for quality testing in sectors like biotechnology and healthcare. Our unique approach combines advanced sensor technology with machine learning and deep expertise in our application areas.
   

  

 Our team consists of 30+ full-time employees from 16 countries, united by a shared commitment to advancing technology in life sciences. English is our primary working language.
   

  

 Position Requirements
   

  

**Industry Experience:** 
 10+ years in software management, ideally within a technology-intensive or software-centric industry.
   

  

**Technical Expertise:** 
 You maintain hands-on experience in software development, keeping your programming skills up-to-date.
   

  

**Leadership & Organization:** 
 You are adept at managing complex projects and diverse teams, ensuring timely deliveries and maintaining high standards of quality.
   

  

**Collaborative Mindset:** 
 You work effectively with cross-functional teams, including developers, testers, scientists, and product managers, creating a collaborative and innovative environment.
   

  

**Product Involvement:** 
 You have a technical understanding of our solutions and work closely with the development teams to ensure ongoing improvement.
   

  

 Key Technical Skills
   

  

* DevOps (experience with Azure DevOps is a plus), Git, CI/CD
* .NET (C#)
* Desktop UI development using MVVM (experience with WPF is a plus)
* ORM (Entity Framework Core)


**Additional Skills**
* Firmware development (C/C++, STM32)
* Knowledge of regulatory standards in software for biotech and healthcare applications
* Experience with distributed software systems


 Why Join?
   

  

* Impactful Work: Take the lead on projects that are advancing technology in the life sciences field.
* Innovative Projects: Drive forward high-level software projects that push the boundaries in our technology and product landscape.
* Team-Centric Culture: Join a diverse, multicultural team of dedicated professionals who thrive on collaboration and technical challenges.


 If you are an experienced, organized, and people-focused software manager eager to stay engaged with technology and lead groundbreaking R&D projects, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 Application Details
   

  

 Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, and we encourage candidates from the Stockholm-Uppsala area to apply. Applications will be accepted until December 6th.

title: Test Developer
description:
Test developer
   

  

 Do you have experience building automated and simulated setups to test software products? Do you like to code in python and find bugs in software? Are you motivated by working for a successful company that innovates with food production and sustainability? Then we might be a good fit!
   

  

 Being in the center of the system you will be collaborating with many different stakeholders including the software teams, product owners, architects and hardware teams. We are currently creating new products in software which enables several new technologies. We are an agile collaborative team releasing in a regular cadence.
   

  

 The Farm Automation team is developing system software for connecting our embedded products to our cloud and on prem solutions. Most of our team software is back-end, some front end applications and surrounding test code in python. We simulate and automate our test suites to perform as close as we can to a real farm with milking cows.
   

  

 The position is based in Tumba, just south of Stockholm, and we offer a hybrid workplace where we work about 3 days a week in the office.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 You and the team will take ownership of the test code for our components, including performance and capacity setups collaborating with several teams.
   

  

**Requirements**
 To be successful in this role you need to have experience in Python coding.
   

  

 You have the following engineering proficiencies
   

  

* Eagerness to learn functional system behaviour
* Working with requirements
* Creation of simulated and automated tests
* Real time or performance focused coding
* Build pipelines and parallel execution of test setups
* DevOps CI/CD experience
* Python, SQL, Gitlab, Jira/Confluence


 We believe that you have a technical education and software development experience.
   

  

 As a person we believe that you are a team player who is not afraid of taking initiatives and reaching out to other parts of the organization to find the best solution. This requires solution thinking, communication, and coordination skills. You should be curious and eager to learn, both our own applications, and the surrounding systems as well as the dairy farm domain in general.
   

  

 In addition to above requirements;
   

  

* Work permit in EU
* Know Swedish or you have a desire to learn it.
* You are fluent in English


**Nice to have**
* A university degree, B.Sc. or M.Sc. in computer science, software engineering or equivalent
* Applicable certifications, for example ISTQB
* 5 years work experience


**Do you want to know more?**
 To apply, please click at the apply button. If you have any questions, please contact HR or recruiting manager Magnus Östvall. Please note that applications will not be accepted by email. The selection process is ongoing. You are welcome to submit your application!
   

  

**Search** 
 : Software Developer, Python, DB, Agile, Test automation, Software test
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of system solutions for dairy farmers globally. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 Please visit www.corporate.delaval.com for more information.

* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures.
* Experience working in a customer-facing role


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
Är du vårt nästa proffs inom Machine Learning? Nu söker vi en MLOps engineer som kan ta en central roll i att utveckla och vidmakthålla vår ML-infrastruktur från grunden. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att designa och utveckla effektiva och skalbara lösningar för modellträning, distribution, övervakning och hantering, som alla bidrar till en hållbar framtid.
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 I rollen som MLOps engineer kommer du att vara en central del i skapandet av vår ML-infrastruktur. Ditt arbete kommer att innebära att utveckla och underhålla vår ML-plattform i Vertex, där du säkerställer att data är i ett användbart tillstånd för alla våra användare. Du kommer arbeta enligt DevOps principer och förväntas röra dig i gränslandet mellan "ops" och "dev" samt applicera innovativa lösningar på vår ML-platform. Du kommer att designa och bygga datapipelines som effektivt omvandlar och transporterar stora datamängder till ett format som är lättillgängligt för slutanvändarna, samtidigt som du säkerställer en högkvalitativ och enhetlig produktionssättning.
   

  

 Din expertis kommer att vara avgörande när det gäller att implementera och automatisera genom kontinuerlig integration (CI), kontinuerlig leverans (CD) och kontinuerlig träning (CT) för våra ML-system. Genom att skapa modulariserade kodkomponenter som är återanvändbara och komponerbara, bidrar du till en smidig och effektiv ML-pipeline. Du kommer också att vara ansvarig för att övervaka alla steg i konstruktionen av ML-systemet, från integration och testning till releaser, deployment och infrastrukturhantering.
   

  

**Är du den som kommer att göra det?**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha erfarenhet av infrastruktur i molnet och programmering i Python. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Vertex AI, GCP, samt kunskap i Big Query och SQL.
   

  

 Som vår MLOps engineer kommer du att integrera modeller och system i befintliga produktionssystem och automatisera processer för byggen, träning, deployment, monitorering, modelloptimering och återträning av modeller. Det är en roll som kräver en person som är redo att ta sig an utmaningar och driva teknisk innovation framåt. Arbetet kräver tidigare erfarenhet och kunskap inom automatisering, configuration management och containerbaserade systemflöden.
   

  

 Som person är det viktigt att du har ett coachande arbetssätt, både till våra Data Scientists och inom ML-Engineering. Vi tror att du gillar samarbete, ta dig an nya tekniker och tar egna initiativ för att driva området och Svenska Spel framåt.
   

  

**Vi Ser Att Du Har Följande Erfarenhet**
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur i molnet
* Programmering i Python
* Bygga CI/CD flöden och att kunna automatisering
* Modellutveckling
* Erfarenhet av ML-Ops


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Också Har**
* Erfarenhet av Vertex AI och GCP.
* Kunskap i Big Query
* SQL
* Terraform


**Om Tech på Svenska Spel**
 På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi är med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tvärtom. Och som ett techbolag som sysslar med spel kommer ett ansvar, både för folks drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Det är också därför du kommer märka att vårt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela företaget från första dagen du börjar jobba hos oss.
   

  

**Vi är Svenska Spel**
 Svenska Spel är hela Sveriges spelbolag. Vi skapar hållbara och roliga spelupplevelser som bidrar till ett bättre Sverige. Genom spel som Triss, Stryktipset och Oddset ger vi våra fyra miljoner kunder spänning, glädje och drömmar. Våra spel är enkla och trygga och oavsett om man spelar online eller fysiskt, själv eller tillsammans med andra, så ska upplevelsen alltid vara positiv. Vi vill att fler ska spela hållbart hos oss och vår verksamhet ska bedrivas på ett socialt, ekonomiskt och miljömässigt ansvarsfullt sätt. Varje år går överskottet till statskassan. Vi är Sveriges största idrottssponsor och investerar nära 300 miljoner kronor årligen i svensk idrott. Vi är modiga, nyfikna och strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör samt skapar resultat tillsammans.
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem här:
   

  

 https://career.svenskaspel.se/pages/formaner
   

  

  

  

**A** 
**nsökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering i Visby eller Solna. Hos oss gör vi jobbet där det passar bäst, ibland är det hemma och ibland är det på kontoret. Vi utför urval och intervjuer löpande så tveka inte på att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Erik Andersson,
   

  

 erik.andersson@svenskaspel.se,
   

  

 eller Hanna Gruselius, hanna.gruselius@svenskaspel.se som jobbar som MLE idag och kan svara på hur det är att jobba som MLE hos oss på Svenska Spel.
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Projektledare - HR-Digitalisering, Stockholm
description:
🚀
 **Gå med i vårt team på VIPAS AB som Projektledare - HR-Digitalisering!** 
 🚀
   

  

 Har du vad som krävs för att trivas i den dynamiska IT-konsultvärlden? VIPAS AB, ett växande företag, bjuder in dig att ta del av nästa spännande projekt som vår nya medarbetare!
   

  

**Om VIPAS**
 Föreställ dig en värld där din affärsteknik är perfekt anpassad till dina mål – effektiv, skalbar och innovativ. På VIPAS AB är det precis vad vi strävar efter att skapa. Som ett IT-konsultföretag erbjuder vi inte bara tjänster, vi levererar skräddarsydda lösningar med hjälp av den senaste tekniken som Java och Python. Vårt team har gedigen erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling, DevOps och ingenjörskonst, och vi leder er genom den moderna teknikens landskap med trygghet och framförhållning.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning:** 
 Vi söker en Projektledare för HR-digitalisering med placering i Stockholm. Denna roll kräver en högt kvalificerad professionell som ska leda HR-digitaliseringsprojekt med fokus på att förbättra operationell effektivitet.
   

  

**Nyckelansvar**
* Projektledning: Leda HR-digitaliseringsprojekt med över 6 års erfarenhet.
* Kravställning: Genomföra 3+ uppdrag för att definiera krav för HR-system (t.ex. löneadministration, rekrytering).
* Förändringshantering: Visa praktisk erfarenhet av förändringshantering inom organisationer med 500+ anställda (2+ uppdrag).
* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor: Hantera 2+ projekt inom offentlig sektor eller reglerade miljöer.
* Agila metoder: Tillämpa agila/iterativa metoder med minst 2 års erfarenhet.
* Relevant utbildning: Ha en examen inom ett relaterat HR-område.
* Marknadsanalys: Genomföra marknadsanalyser för digitala HR-lösningar (2+ uppdrag).


**Krav**
* Minst sex (6) års erfarenhet inom projektledning för HR-digitaliseringsprojekt.
* Minst tre (3) genomförda uppdrag som involverar kravställning för HR-system (t.ex. löneadministration, rekryteringssystem, lärplattformar).
* Minst två (2) uppdrag som visar praktisk erfarenhet av förändringshantering inom stora organisationer (500+ anställda).
* Flytande svenska och stark projektledningsförmåga.
* Erfarenhet av processutveckling och förändringshantering, samt kännedom om HR-funktioner och digitalisering.
* Kunskap om agila metoder.


 #HRDigitalization #HRJobs #ProjectManager #DigitalTransformation #HRTech #ChangeManagement #AgileHR #HumanResources #TechInHR #JobOpportunity #CareerInHR #HRLeadership #InnovationInHR #DigitalHR #TalentManagement
   

  

**Varför jobba hos oss?**
 VIPAS AB erbjuder attraktiva anställningspaket för IT-konsulter, i enlighet med Teknikföretagens (Almega) kollektivavtal. Att arbeta med oss innebär möjligheter inom olika branscher, vilket ger dig flexibilitet och möjligheter till utveckling. Om du är drivande och redo att anta nya utmaningar, är VIPAS familjen för dig!
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett innovativt team som driver framtiden inom telekom, fordon, detaljhandel och bank. Om du är redo att ta dig an utmanande projekt och växa i en banbrytande miljö, är detta möjligheten för dig!
   

  

**Ansök nu**
 Tveka inte att kontakta oss på priyanka@vipas.se eller ringa oss på
 **+46727749222**
**Observera:** 
 Ansök om du har
 **Sveriges PR/citizenship** 
 eller ett
 **arbetstillstånd för Sverige** 
 .
   

  

**Hur Ansöker Du**
 Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att skicka in sitt CV och personliga brev. Gå med oss och driv innovation på VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Observera att vi rekryterar löpande, vilket innebär att uppdraget kan stängas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Om du är intresserad rekommenderar vi att du ansöker omedelbart!

title: Senior Back End Developer - JAVA
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Collaborate with our squad and key internal partners to determine how to design scalable backend systems, data models and APIs that run on Google Cloud Platform.
   

  

 Architect, develop and operate Java services that serve our users through our content platform which enables marketing operators and other internal squads to work efficiently. Be a technical leader, mentor and valued contributor in an autonomous, cross-functional agile squad, in close collaboration with other squads.
   

  

 Collaborate with other engineers and product managers to identify and solve challenging problems, to successfully scale our automation and platformization work to enable a more user-focussed conversion experience.

**Java** 
 .
   

  

* 
* Additional tools and technologies such as gRPC, GCP, BigQuery and Bigtable are


 a plus.
   

  

* 
* You have strong computer science fundamentals and previous experience building


 backend services at scale.
   

  

*

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 03-11-2024

 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, AI, Machine Learning, Test, Cloud, Infra DevOps, , IT-Projektledning.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
