title: Junior Portfolio Analyst Nordics Asset Management Stockholm
description:
*We offer an opportunity you simply won’t find anywhere else. In less than four years, Mileway has grown into Europe’s leader in last mile logistics real estate, with a 550-plus team across more than twenty offices in ten countries.*  

  

Are you a proactive, dynamic and driven analyst, ready to take the first or next step in your real estate career? We are looking for a Junior Analyst to join us on our new adventure in the Nordics, based in either Stockholm. You’ll be part of a young, dynamic team, working alongside colleagues from all over the world. You’ll report directly to the Head of Sweden, as we build on our portfolio and consolidate our position as the market leader in last mile real estate.  

This is an exceptional opportunity to build and shape your own position as you grow your professional experience. Under the leadership of experienced senior colleagues, you’ll work on various in-depth analyses and create the strong market knowledge we need to help our business grow. You’ll work alongside our international team, helping drive our premium asset portfolio, and join us on our journey as we develop best-in-class tools and dashboards.  

As Junior Portfolio Analyst, you’ll have responsibilities on both a country and international level. As a local market specialist, you’ll focus on the Swedish, Finnish and Danish markets, providing country-level analytics support. You’ll also be collaborating closely with our Amsterdam-based Portfolio Management team on ad hoc and ongoing projects. In this part of your role, you’ll provide essential support and country-specific insights to the Portfolio Management team as they manage performance optimization and report Mileway’s performance to its shareholder.  


**Working at Mileway**
We offer an opportunity you simply won’t find anywhere else. Launched in 2019, Mileway has rapidly grown into Europe’s leader in last-mile logistics real estate, with a team of over 550 across more than twenty offices in 11 countries. From the start, Mileway set out to be a different kind of real estate company, with a cloud-based IT infrastructure and a team that combines local expertise with the pooled strengths of a pan-European presence.  

  

Our culture is fast-paced and highly international, with team members from more than 50 countries, bringing diverse perspectives and a “can-do” attitude to everything we do. While we have already achieved a lot, we’re only just getting started – our mission is to be the most customer- and climate-focused last-mile real estate company in Europe, creating space for businesses to grow sustainably. To get there, we live by our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.  

  

At Mileway, we believe company growth comes from supporting the growth of our combined capabilities. That’s why we offer an in-house learning & development program where personal, professional, and business development go hand in hand, helping you carve out your own unique career path. While your base will be our Stockholm office, we embrace a flexible approach to work, supported by a state-of-the-art technology package to keep you connected wherever you are.  


Join us in shaping the future of last-mile real estate  


**What you’ll do**
* Provide analytical support the Country Director and team on investment analyses, due diligence, and new opportunities
* Perform in-depth asset- and portfolio-level analysis (leasing, Capex, NOI, etc.) and prepare high-quality reporting on past, current and projected performance
* Collaborate with the central SP&A team by providing country-specific input needed for regular and ad-hoc reporting
* Provide integral support in the hold/sell analysis of individual assets
* Assist in the creation of NOI forecasts on stabilized assets, value add opportunities and acquisitions
* Collaborate on asset business plans and annual budgeting
* Analyze and identify specific asset level risks and support the AM organization
* Create strong commercial asset and market knowledge
* Learn the systems used to manage and track the portfolio performance (Yardi, Tableau, Excel, banking systems, etc.). Support us with optimizing systems and processes.

  


**What you’ll bring**  

* Up to three years’ experience in a relevant area, ideally in private equity or asset management, and preferably with a focus on real estate.
* Strong numerical and analytical skills and ability to work with complex and big data sets (Excel)
* A strong academic background (Bachelor’s degree) in a relevant area, for example in Finance or Real Estate studies
* Commercial mindset and great communication skills You understand the numbers and you can explain to others what they mean.
* Your team attitude. You have a knack for building relationships across all areas within a fast-paced environment.
* Your excellent problem-solving skills. You know how to solve problems and have the tenacity to get things done.
* Language skills. You’ll need to be fluent in Swedish/Danish and have an excellent command of English as you will be liaising with the Amsterdam based Portfolio Management and FP&A teams on a daily basis. If you have additional languages, that’s better still.
* Your head for data. You’ll be able to digitize and track new data, and take it all in your stride.
  

*Our vision is to be the number one gateway to urban communities. To get there, we live our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.*

title: Solution Consultant to Accenture Song
description:
**Accenture Song** — As the world’s largest, most disruptive digital agency, we drive lasting growth for clients by helping them design, build, and run meaningful business and customer experiences. We are a bold and generous team of creatives, designers, technologists, strategists and engineers working together to make possibilities a reality. Accenture Song is committed to our employees and helps you get the most out of your career by igniting your full potential!


For the team in Copenhagen and Stockholm, Accenture Song is seeking a Solution Consultant with developer background ready to contribute to global digital marketing projects for a range of international brands. Here you will have the ability to contribute and grow quickly in a truly international environment when advising our clients throughout the implementation process and together we create a playful and warm culture that gives room to grow and thrive.

 **Is this the right role for you?**


Do you want new challenges in a forward-looking and energetic environment with focus leading marketing technologies, such as Adobe Experience Cloud or Salesforce Marketing Cloud? You will be working cross-functionally with our project managers, marketing consultant, creatives and other solution consultants to implement new tools and platforms for our clients.


  

**We are looking for a new colleague with the following profile:**

* Master’s or bachelor’s degree in computer science, software development or similar background
* You have experience with solutions within the Adobe Experience Cloud or similar marketing and e-commerce technologies
* Minimum 2 years of experience with Adobe Marketo or Adobe Campaign
* You have experience as a back end or full stack developer and possess excellent programming skills.
* You have experience working with data modelling and integrations and do not shy away when it comes to making architectural decisions
* Analytic mindset – you enjoy working close to clients, with the ability to keep an overview when working with data
* You enjoy finding solid solutions for complex challenges and helping clients to plot a course in the ever-changing landscape of marketing technology
* You have solid English communication skills in both writing and speaking
* You are self-motivated and an excellent team player with a strong collaborative attitude

 **What is in it for you?**

* A good and inclusive working environment, where you will work with inspiring and highly motivated team of experienced developers making you grow both personally and professionally.
* You will have the ability to develop your career and build your technical and analytical skills while gaining knowledge in marketing technologies and the latest trends in marketing automation.
* Meaningful and interesting client project. Early on you will be given responsibility and therefore have an impact on delivering exciting projects.
* You will get the chance to work with big clients and have your fingerprint in the development process and in Accenture Song as an organization.
* A dedicated mentor following your career journey and a strong learning culture
* Responsibility, trust and an inclusive work environment
* The opportunity to get involved in Accenture´s volunteering, sport- and social groups
* Access to industry and capability specialists in all corners of the world with first-class international knowledge and experience
* Competitive compensation and benefits

**Investing in you**


Choose a career at Accenture and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life. Submit your application, CV, cover letter and relevant degrees online today.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Nya möjligheter via D-Source 2025
description:
Vi har under 2024 träffat många bolag, där flera av dem säger att de kommer se över resurs/personal behov mot slutet av året. Nu är vi där och vi ser faktiskt att behoven och antalet förfrågningar ökar....


För att möta dessa möjligheter vill vi vara förberedda och fylla på kandidatpoolen.


Nu söker vi bland annat:


- Cloud Tekniker - främst inom Azure

* Cyber Security Tekniker
* Nätverkstekniker
* Erfarna Support/Helpdesk Tekniker
* Eller bara dig, oavsett vilken teknikinriktning du har!

  

Är du något av ovan? sänd oss din CV, så skall vi sätta läslampan på dig och se vad vi kan hitta.

title: Junior Testutvecklare till Saab Surveillance
description:
***Tog du nyligen en högskole- eller civilingenjörsutbildning och vill arbeta med testutveckling? Saab söker nu en nyexaminerad Testutvecklare med intresse för elektronik. Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.***

**Att jobba som Testutvecklare hos Saab** **Surveillance**

  

Du kommer ingå i ett team inom support på SAAB Radar Solutions, med både seniora och juniora testutvecklare och mättekniker. Teamet arbetar tätt tillsammans, och stämningen är prestigelös, stödjande och rolig. Teamet har standups för att säkerställa ett effektivt samarbete och teamkänsla.


Teamet ansvarar för att utveckla en helhetslösning baserat på deras testplattformskoncept, där du kommer att delta i samtliga utvecklingsfaser, från koncept till levererat testsystem. Testobjekten är komplexa och varierar från kretskort och kassetter till delsystem. Din roll innebär bland annat att skapa testlådor, utveckla och uppdatera nya funktioner och verifiera egenutvecklade testutrustningar.


Rollen är placerad i Göteborg.

**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**


Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab i Göteborg med start under hösten. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saab samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab.

**Vi söker dig som har:**

  

* + Högskole eller civilingenjörexamen inom mekatronik eller motsvarande
	+ Intresse för elektronik
	+ Datavana
	+ Driv, nyfikenhet och god samarbetsförmåga

Meriterande:

* Erfarenhet av felsökning på kretskort
* Erfarenhet av att skapa kretsscheman
* Kunskap i Labview och Matlab

**Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Jessica på jessica.samuelsson@nexergroup.com


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

  

För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara svenska medborgare samt genomgå en säkerhetsprövning.

**Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* *här**.*

**Om kund**


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 19 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare, mer hållbar och mer rättvis värld. Saab är också ett möjligheternas företag. Ett företag där du som medarbetare får stort ansvar och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Men också ett företag som respekterar varje människas behov av ett liv utanför arbetet. Saab ser mångfald som en tillgång och ständigt lärande som en självklarhet. Tekniskt är de ledande inom många områden och en femtedel av våra intäkter går till forskning och utveckling.

title: BTP Arkitekt i S/4HANA projekt
description:
Integration, AI och andra spännande teknikmöjligheter, här är du som bäst!


Vårt team av utvecklare har bred kunskap inom SAP BTP (Business Technology Plattform) och Fiori och söker nu fler kollegor främst inom integrationsområdet.


Teamet fokuserar dagligen på hur vi kan skapa bättre användarupplevelse, enklare integrationer, djupare analys och effektivare processer i våra kunders SAP-system. Det är utmanande, framåtlutat och riktigt roligt!

**Om Stretch Evolve**


Vi brinner för att göra det svåra enkelt och att utgå från de fördelar ett standardsystem har. Vi utgår från best practice som finns i SAP och visar på möjligheterna. Våra kunder står ofta inför en spännande tillväxtresa. Tillsammans skapar vi framtidens vinnare!


Nyfiken på att bli en del av vårt SAP team?

**Vi tror att du:**

* har praktisk erfarenhet av att sätta upp och konfigurera integrationer mellan SAP och andra system/applikationer
* har erfarenhet av REST API:er, API utveckling, API Management, mikrotjänster
* har flera års erfarenhet av att leda och driva integrationsprojekt
* är självgående, analytisk, strukturerad, proaktiv, lösningsorienterad
* behärskar svenska språket

**Någon eller några av nedan erfarenheter hjälper dig att lyckas i denna roll:**

* Praktisk erfarenhet av SAP BTP
* Erfarenhet av SAP BTP Integration Suite, SAP PI/XI
* Praktisk erfarenhet av integrationer mellan SAP Cloud system och andra Cloud system eller onPrem system
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i ABAP, Java, Javascript, Groovy Script, XSLT
* Erfarenhet av SOAP, OData, IDOC, JSON, XML
* Erfarenhet av protokoll och säkerhetsformat som SSL, OAuth, SAML, JWT, SSH
* Erfarenhet av containertekniker som Docker och Kubernetes

  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


Hälsar teamet på Stretch Evolve
company_description: Stretch gör skillnad genom att ha affärsvärde i fokus, leveransförmåga i toppklass och entreprenörskap i vårt DNA. Dessutom har vi riktigt roligt när vi jobbar tillsammans. Följ med oss!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


**Requirements**
* Take ownership of the continuous delivery pipeline, collaborating closely with software development teams to release production-ready software on a daily basis.
* Serve as the primary contact for the hosting partner.
* Manage and maintain test, stage, and production environments.
* Bring hands-on experience in Agile/SCRUM methodologies, especially with distributed teams.
* Collaborate with the SCRUM Master and Product Owner to align on requirements.
* Utilize tools like JIRA and Confluence for project management and documentation.
* Demonstrate a willingness to learn new tools and techniques as needed to deliver results.
* Communicate effectively across teams and stakeholders.
* Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer on at least one large-scale, cloud-based web or e-commerce solution.
* Expertise in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) processes and tools.
* Proficiency with continuous integration tools, such as TeamCity, Octopus, and PowerShell.
* Strong experience with the Microsoft Azure platform, including Service Fabric, Application Gateways, and API Management.
* Experience working with Kubernetes.
* Skilled in monitoring production environments and configuring/managing CDNs like Akamai.
* Familiar with security configurations in CDN environments (e.g., Akamai).
* Experience with CI/CD tools like Octopus Deploy and knowledge of infrastructure as code and infrastructure provisioning.
* Agile team experience.
* Strong communication skills.
* Familiarity with unit testing and automated testing tools.


**Benefits**
* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Presale specialist inom Cyber Security
description:
***Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för ”The Iver way”.***
*Har du en passion för cybersäkerhet och försäljning? Vill du vara med och skydda företag mot cyberhot genom att erbjuda avancerade säkerhetslösningar? Vi söker nu en Presale specialist med starkt kommersiellt fokus inom cybersäkerhet till vårt team!
 *Är du vår nya kollega?**
**Om Cyberdefense**
 Cyberdefense at Iver är en fristående affärsenhet inom Iver som enbart fokuserar på att skydda företag mot de ständigt växande cyberhoten. Genom innovativa tjänster och djup kompetens inom cybersäkerhetsområdet hjälper vi våra kunder att säkra sin IT-infrastruktur och sina affärsprocesser.
   

  

**Din roll på Iver?**
 Som Presale specialist inom cybersäkerhet kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att identifiera och utveckla nya affärsmöjligheter inom området. Du kommer att arbeta proaktivt med att hitta potentiella kunder och skapa nya affärsmöjligheter, samt att arbeta tillsammans med våra kundansvariga i olika upphandlingsprocesser och merförsäljningsprojekt. Genom att bygga och upprätthålla långsiktiga relationer med både interna och externa intressenter, säkerställer du att vi kan leverera skräddarsydda lösningar som möter våra kunders specifika behov inom Cyber security.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter.
* Agera rådgivare till och samarbeta med våra övriga försäljningsteam.
* Genomföra omfattande behovsanalyser för att förstå kundens unika utmaningar och därefter presentera skräddarsydda säkerhetslösningar.
* Delta i vidareutveckling av vår tjänsteportfölj inom cybersäkerhet.
* Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med våra tekniska experter för att säkerställa att de lösningar vi erbjuder är optimala och tekniskt solida.
* Delta aktivt i marknadsföringsaktiviteter och branschevenemang för att öka vår synlighet och utöka vårt professionella nätverk.


 Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa att våra kunder får den bästa möjliga servicen och att vi kan bygga långsiktiga, framgångsrika affärsrelationer. Denna roll erbjuder en spännande möjlighet att arbeta i framkant av cybersäkerhet, med stor variation i arbetsuppgifter och möjligheten att göra en verklig skillnad för våra kunder.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
**Iver - Where technology meets business.** 
 Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Iver är ett bolag med entreprenöriella rötter och en kultur som präglas av flexibilitet och samarbete. Vårt mål är att våra kunder – här i Norden och internationellt – ska se oss som en ledande partner för digital transformation.
   

  

 På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden.
   

  

 Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
 **We’re not big blue. We’re yellow.** 
 Stora nog att skala och agila nog att innovera.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 För att lyckas i rollen som presale specialist inom cybersäkerhet tror vi att du har några års erfarenhet av försäljning inom IT-säkerhet. Du har en stark förståelse för cybersäkerhet och dess utmaningar, vilket gör dig till en värdefull rådgivare för våra kunder. Du har inga bekymmer att ifrågasätta kundkrav och du besitter förmågan att hjälpa kunden hitta den bästa lösningen, även om det innebär att ställa svåra frågor.
   

  

 Vidare tror vi att du är självständig och en lagspelare, vilket gör att du kan arbeta effektivt på egen hand såväl som i samarbete med kollegor. Samt besitter en hög grad av självdisciplin och driv för att vara framgångsrik i rollen.
   

  

**Du Har**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av framgångsrik försäljning av komplexa cybersäkerhetsaffärer.
* Erfarenhet av att förmedla komplexa säkerhetslösningar på ett enkelt och övertygande sätt.
* Goda kommunikations och prestations färdigheter inklusive upphandlingar.
* Obehindrad kommunikation på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


*Då rollen ingår i vårt affärsområde inom Cyberdefense genomför vi mer omfattade bakgrundskontroller under denna rekryteringsprocess för att möta våra kunders säkerhetskrav.*
**Placeringsort**
 Vi finns på 25 kontor runt om i Sverige och Norge. Placeringsort för denna roll är på vårat kontor i Solna.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-15. Du är välkommen att kontakta Poonam Jain (poonam.jain@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Iver!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: AWS Cloud Specialist
description:
**About Redeploy Build**
 At Redeploy Build, we are cloud specialists. What we do is build and integrate best-in-breed cloud environments, steering clear of legacy constraints and “old-IT”.
   

  

 We help our clients within all areas of public cloud - from building, governing, migrating and optimizing our client’s cloud resources. Living by a “Cloud always, in all ways” motto, we always get things done and are not just another powerpoint-firm, rather getting our hands dirty and putting tech into practice. Learn more about us here.
   

  

 As a rapidly growing public cloud company, we understand that our success depends on the talents we choose to surround ourselves with. Now we are looking for an AWS Cloud Specialist in Stockholm or Gothenburg who wants to be a part of our continued success story. Maybe it's you?
   

  

**What it means to be a AWS Cloud Specialist Consultant at Redeploy Build**
 As an AWS Cloud Specialist, you will be at the forefront of assisting and mentoring mid-sized and enterprise scale clients in optimizing their AWS infrastructure. With your expertise in AWS platforms and architecture, you’ll provide insights into best practices, emerging technologies and industry trends to help our clients make informed decisions.
   

  

 In this role you’ll be working closely with cross-functional teams including developers, cloud-teams and business stakeholders to align AWS cloud infrastructure initiatives with organizational goals, as well as getting your hands dirty implementing tailored AWS cloud solutions.
   

  

**Some Of Your Tasks Will For Amongst Others Be**
* Leading advanced technical implementations within your area of expertise.
* Understand and align infrastructure initiatives with business objectives, demonstrating a keen understanding of the broader organizational context.
* Act as a mentor and pre-sales resource for your area of expertise.


**Who are you?**
 We believe that you have a passion for cloud development and that you enjoy creating value and solving problems for clients and businesses. You’re open-minded, positive, driven and a curious person who understands the power of team collaboration and sharing knowledge with your fellow colleagues and our clients.
   

  

**What experiences do you bring?**
* Extensive experience and expertise in infrastructure technologies, including cloud computing, networking, virtualization, and containerization.
* Ability to understand and align infrastructure initiatives with business objectives, demonstrating a keen understanding of the broader organizational context.
* Hands-on experience with IaC (Infrastructure-as-Code) with CloudFormation, CDK and/or terraform for example, version control systems (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams.
* A proactive and curious attitude towards learning new technologies and methodologies.
* Great communication skills, both verbal and written in Swedish and English, to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


**And** 
**if you come with following experiences, you will stick out from the crowd!**
* Well-Architected Framework, Landing Zones and Cloud Governance.
* Container management and microservices such as Kubernetes, Docker and Openshift.
* Data and Analytics such as Databricks and Snowflake
* Developer Experience, Cloud Optimization, Machine Learning and FinOps framework.


 🤝
 **What we offer**
 Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.
   

  

**To Learn More About Our Benefits, Scroll Down 👇🏼**
 📍
 **Location**
 We have offices located in central Stockholm, Göteborg and Jönköping. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our any office locations.
   

  

 📩
 **How to apply**
 We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.
   

  

 We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. To be compliant with GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers channel. Please submit your application using the form on our career website, or any website displaying a position with us.
   

  

 For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson.
   

  

 We look forward hearing from you!

title: HR Advisor
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences to their customers. More than 150,000 businesses - including many of the world's largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
   

  

 We dream big - for our company, our customers and our employees - and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries - probably somewhere near you!
   

  

 We are currently transforming Sinch HR, to be fit for purpose for the future. This includes the design of new global HR processes, implementation of new HR technology and improved ways of working, with the establishment of a Global HR Operations capability.
   

  

 To strengthen HR Operations, we are now looking for a HR Advisor. This is an excellent opportunity to influence and shape the delivery of future HR services at Sinch.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The HR Advisor is responsible for providing comprehensive HR support and services to employees and managers. The role involves responding to inquiries, resolving issues, delivering accurate information on HR policies, processes and routines and handling operational tasks across HR service areas.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Employee and Manager Support**
* Serve as the first point of contact for employees and managers inquiries
* Address and resolve inquiries related to HR policies and processes, and ensuring HR information is accurate.
* Provide guidance on self-service tools and resources available to employees and managers.


**Operational support in lifecycle processes**
* Support with operational tasks in yearly recurring processes, such as Performance Management, Merit, Bonus and Engagement survey.
* Manage other operational tasks in HR processes such as onboarding, offboarding, recruitment, benefit administration, rehabilitation, sick leave, mobility, health and wellness etc as agreed with COP and HRBP.
* Handling country/regional operational support as agreed.
* Serve as Process Expert for some processes, including support, training and close collaboration with process owners and HR.


**HR Operations team member**
* Support with HR Data Management tasks as a back up when needed.


 The role is part of the Global HR Operations team and is based at our HQ in Stockholm. It report to the Regional HR Operations Manager APAC/EMEA, who will be based in India.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity to join a newly created team and build the HR OPS capabilities globally.
   

  

**About You**
 To be successful in the role you have a real passion for HR, processes and communication and you love working in a global environment! You have excellent communication skills. You love solving problems and are used to handling sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
   

  

* Proficiency in using HR systems and help desk software systems to manage inquiries, track tickets, and document resolutions
* Demonstrated experience in providing high-quality customer service within HR.
* Strong knowledge of HR policies, processes and employment regulations.
* Fluency in English.


**Our Values**
 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple" and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
   

  

**Bring your authentic self to Sinch**
 Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
   

  

 We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
   

  

 Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
   

  

 If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/

title: Identity Management Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Join Our Client's Cybersecurity Team!** 




 I’m excited to share an opportunity with one of my esteemed clients, a leading provider of cybersecurity solutions. They specialize in helping organizations tackle the complexities of the security lifecycle, ensuring businesses can navigate today’s digital landscape with confidence. With their extensive global resources and advanced technologies, they create tailored, integrated solutions to address unique cybersecurity challenges across various industries.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 They are currently looking for a talented Identity and Access Management (IAM) Security Specialist to join their dynamic team. If you have deep functional and technical expertise in implementing security solutions that align with business objectives, this could be the perfect fit for you. You’ll play a key role in designing and delivering systems that establish user credentials and secure access to enterprise applications.
 



  





**What They’re Looking For** 




 They want someone who is not only a cybersecurity expert but also passionate about outsmarting potential threats. You’ll need to have a proven track record of solving security challenges for clients while fostering a collaborative team environment.
 



  





 Key qualifications include:
 



  




* Analyzing clients’ security postures and anticipating their requirements
* Creating tailored solutions based on industry best practices
* Experience in fast-paced, team-oriented environments
* Strong documentation skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences



  





**Responsibilities** 




 In this role, you will manage the daily operations of the client’s Identity Management systems. Your responsibilities will include:
 



  




* Installing, configuring, and deploying IAM solutions for User Life-Cycle Management, Identity and Access Governance, Automated Provisioning, Single Sign-On, Federation, and Privileged Account Management
* Overseeing complex Privileged Access Management (PAM) infrastructure, including password vaults and session monitoring services
* Troubleshooting issues related to password rotation, account onboarding, and integrations with AD/LDAP and SIEM solutions
* Developing and executing test plans for IAM solutions
* Administering privileged user accounts across various platforms, including Windows and UNIX
* Integrating systems like different LDAP providers and database servers
* Performing health checks on servers to ensure consistent availability



  





**Travel Requirements** 




 Please note that some travel may be required, varying from 0% to 100% depending on business needs.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 Here’s what they’re looking for:
 


* A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience (minimum 12 years; if you have an Associate’s Degree, at least 6 years of relevant work)
* At least 2 years of experience managing cloud privileged identities across various platforms
* Experience with AD, LDAP, JDBC, SNOW connectors, and end-to-end lifecycle management
* A minimum of 3 years of experience with one of the following IAM technologies:
* Saviynt, SailPoint, CyberArk, or Ping



  





**Additional Qualifications/Experience (not required):** 



* Exposure to I&AM practitioners and experience working with C-Level clients
* Industry-recognized security certifications (e.g., CISSP) and I&AM vendor certifications
* Experience in deploying and implementing custom applications
* Knowledge in areas like application security, data security, and infrastructure security



  





 If you’re ready to make an impact in a challenging and rewarding environment, I encourage you to apply!

title: Engineer - Stockholm
description:
Be a part of the next big thing
   

  

 Do you thrive on tackling complex challenges? Are you passionate about creating impactful solutions that drive commerce forward? Are you someone who believes in encouraging and elevating those around you?
   

  

**About Us**
 Kustom, formerly known as Klarna Checkout (KCO), is the Nordic market leader in digital checkout solutions. Today, we support over 24,000 merchants across more than 170 countries, providing a streamlined checkout experience. We offer localized solutions in 18 markets, tailored to specific languages, currencies, and payment methods. No matter where your business operates, we deliver a checkout experience that meets the needs of both merchants and shoppers—driving growth globally. 🌍
   

  

 The role
   

  

 This position offers a unique and exciting opportunity to take on advanced technical and business challenges in collaboration with talented peers as part of a cross-functional Agile team. By joining Kustom, you’ll have the chance to create great digital products that make a real difference in people’s lives and support the success of millions of merchants around the world. You'll be part of a dedicated team committed to delivering top-tier payment experiences for users and their customers on a global scale.
   

  

 Things you'll be doing
   

  

* Focus on growing your skills while delivering high-quality solutions to our users
* Work as part of a team, actively participating in planning, refining, delivering, and reviewing sprint progress
* Collaborate closely with Product and Design teams to fully understand context, requirements, and vision


**Skills And Experience You'll Need**
* Strong proficiency in Backend development, particularly with Java
* Familiarity with frameworks such as Springboot
* Basic understanding of cloud services, especially AWS
* Experience with relational databases and data storage solutions
* Competence in using Git and GitHub for version control and team collaboration
* A solid grasp of RESTful APIs and how they function


 We believe you'll thrive in this role if you have
   

  

* A passion for Backend Engineering and a proactive, positive mindset
* A desire to learn and improve, with an enthusiasm for developing new skills
* Curiosity and energy that drive you to create exceptional user experiences
* Confidence in sharing your knowledge while being open to feedback and learning from peers
* A genuine commitment to delivering fantastic outcomes for users


**Benefits**
* Comprehensive benefits package tailored to support your well-being and financial security
* Robust pension plan with national and occupational components
* Excellent health insurance coverage, including long-term illness protection and salary exchange options
* Flexible work model with 2 days per week at home and 3 days per week in our vibrant office ✌️
* Annual wellness allowance of 3,000 SEK to invest in your health and fitness
* Extra day off when major holidays (e.g., Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve) fall on weekends
* Continuous learning opportunities and professional development support


 A place to grow
   

  

 At Kustom, you’re not going to be just another face in the crowd. This is a place where we elevate each other and celebrate success as a team. We believe in our ability to create excellence — and have fun doing it!
   

  

 And we know we set high expectations, but we also know that the road to success isn’t a straight line. We support and encourage each other to try, to fail, to try again. Because that’s how we grow, individually and together.
   

  

 Does this sound like the place for you?
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please apply in English. At Kustom we welcome everyone! We don’t care where you’re from, whom you love, what kind of food is your favorite (well, unless we’re having a celebration together, then we’ll have to know 😉!), if you believe in this or in that - everyone is welcome!
* Giving the above, we treat all candidates the same! That’s why we have this awesome recruitment tool to keep track of all the amazing talents that apply - so please; apply through the system and we’ll make sure to keep you updated along the recruitment process. And be noticed that we can’t keep track of all CV’s and likewise via email. 🙌
* We value your privacy! When you apply, we'll handle your data with care. Want to know more about how we use your information? Check out our FAQs at the bottom of the jobs page - we've got all the details there for you!

title: Graduate Consultants for Cloud First at Accenture Technology
description:
*Are you ready to put your skills and abilities into practice? Come join Accenture in Stockholm, Malmö or Gothenburg in February or August 2025 and let us help you create the perfect foundation for a career within Technology consulting!*
 Tech Talent Program
   

  

 When entering Accenture Technology as a graduate consultant, you will be part of our Tech Talent Program.
   

  

  

- During the two-year Tech Talent Program, you will go through an intense learning process – with a Buddy and People Lead helping and coaching you to figure out exactly how to develop your career and skills needed to succeed.

- You will be a consultant from day one as you will be part of projects where we implement complex technology and business critical IT systems for our international clients, transforming their business.

- You will build your professional network across the organization by being part of projects, taking part in our communities and by joining our social events and parties.

 Accenture Technology Accenture Technology leverages design thinking, industry insights and the latest digital and security methodologies to help clients innovate, grow, and improve their businesses. Our expertise, capabilities and experience mean that our clients (including some of the biggest brands in the world) trust us to find the right solutions for their needs. Cloud First Accenture continues to lead in the cloud and today has a broad footprint among all the major cloud providers as well as private clouds and on-premise infrastructure. Digital and cloud technologies are changing the way our clients do business and are transforming the operating models and infrastructure at the heart of their operations. We have a clear market differentiation and leadership in New Emerging & Growth Technologies like Extended Reality, Blockchain, Application Security and leveraging our Innovation Architecture that will reflect the essence of the New Engineered Software Technologies
 **About the role**
 Whether you are a programmer guru, a digital innovator, a tech wizard, or a business problem solver, you will find an exciting career path on the cutting edge. We would love to get to know your unique blend of talents and help you explore and grow them further
   

  

*These are some of the responsibilities and tasks that you as a graduate may work with:*
- Help our customers to develop the best IT solutions by being a link between business and IT

- Work with cloud solutions like Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Cloud Platform, Azure and Amazon Web Services

- Support in identifying customer requirements, seek client clarifications, understand compliance and apply modern cloud functionality to meet the requirements

- Work and develop solutions using program languages like Java, Python, SQL and more

- Design and build security in IT environments and cloud platforms

- Support in developing relevant solutions and requirements fitting well to our Journey to the Cloud strategy (J2C)

- Support in Change Management, help clients make best usage of the Accenture assets and best practices across the clouds

- Support project management or other management functions in projects

- Grow your professional skills within analytics, artificial intelligence, Big Data and machine learning

**Who are you?**
- You will soon receive your bachelor’s or master's degree within relevant area

- You want to join our Stockholm office in February or August 2025

- You have excellent written and oral presentation skills in both English and Swedish

- You are ambitious, driven, solution-oriented and motivated to start your career in a technology consulting role

**Application**
 Send your application and attach:
   

  

  

- CV

- Cover Letter (please specify which office(s) your are applying to as well as start in either February or August 2025)

- University transcripts/grades

 Upload all files under "Upload Resume/CV". Please note that all these documents are required for a complete application.
 **Only complete applications are reviewed.** 
 Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in August and get back to you shortly after. Thank you for your interest in Accenture! If your application proceeds to the next step, you will receive an invitation to two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability as well as a personality form.
   

  

**By joining Accenture, you get**
- An end-to-end focus with clients as a trusted partner and advisor to support them from strategy to execution

- Access to a global network of experts and personal co-operation with senior high-performing colleagues and market leading clients

- A career counselor/mentor who helps you define career goals and supports you in achieving your goals and your full potential

- Personal training opportunities and a market leading career-development program. Excellent possibilities for learning and knowledge gain, resulting in a great possibility to grow as both a person and a professional.

- A very strong team culture among supportive colleagues, where team spirit and cooperation are highly valued and rewarded

- Extensive wellbeing program, that boosts your overall wellbeing, energy, and ability to work in a sustainable way.

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well as Inclusion & Diversity networks.

 We look forward to receiving your application! Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!
   

  

**What you also get** 
**:** 
 Accenture IF
   

  

 Accenture IF is a community hosted by our colleagues – for our colleagues, to meet and practice sports and physical activities. We offer a wide range of activities like football, racket sports, running, sailing, golf, yoga and much more.
   

  

 To exercise sports, you enjoy in the company of others, will help you stay motivated and healthy. Join our yearly events such as a cross-country skiing bootcamp, Accenture European Championship in football or an upcoming hiking trip in the mountains. We strongly believe in work-life balance and to have fun together! Parental leave
   

  

 We want our employees to grow and achieve value in life, both in their profession and in their personal life. Accenture offer a market leading compensation for parental leave – we pay for 270 days and compensate 90% of the difference between Social Insurance Agency’s (Försäkringskassan) maximum coverage and a base pay up to 80 000 SEK/month. Sick leave/Well-being
   

  

 In need of medical treatment, we want our employees to get well supported. All Accenture employees are covered by a health insurance by Skandia - Skandia Lifeline Access. The insurance offers healthcare of physical and mental treatments, including rehabilitation. During sick leave you will get well covered, Accenture pay 80% of your salary day 2-14 and 90% day 15-90. Our “Truly Human” network aim to bring us all together – as truly human individuals. We commit to care for ourselves and others, to foster an open-minded and supporting environment. Together we can help each other to achieve our aspirations and become the best version of ourselves. One of many initiatives are “Truly Human Health Academy”, a 100-day journey filled with classes held by health- and dietician experts, workshops, and buddy challenges – to learn and reflect on well-being and daily habits. Networks
   

  

 At Accenture we offer network opportunities, for our employees to meet and share common interests. Our aim is to foster a company culture that stands for inclusion and diversity – a place for everyone in terms of cross-cultural diversity, ethnicity, gender, disability, mental health, and LGBTQI.
   

  

 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
   

  

 All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
   

  

 Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

title: Data Engineer - AWS, Redshift, Python & SQL
Information Technology Security Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Computer and Network Security
description:
**IT-säkerhetarkitekt/IT-säkerhetsspecialist med inriktning mot försvarssektorn** 




  





  





 Vi erbjuder en viktig och stimulerande tjänst där du dagligen bidrar till att skapa ett säkrare Sverige tillsammans med ett trevligt och erfaret team inom säkerhetsområdet.
 



  





 Vi drivs av att stötta våra nationella och internationella kunder med säkerhetskompetens och kännetecknas av ledorden; glädje, kompetens och engagemang!
 



  





 Nu söker vi ytterligare en medarbetare för att komplettera vårt team som jobbar mot Försvarsmakten och försvarsindustrin.
 



 Har du erfarenhet av en eller av flera roller som; IT-säkerhetarkitekter eller IT-säkerhetsspecialister inom försvarssektorn? Du kan du vara aktuell för oss!
 



  





 Dina uppdrag kommer bestå av att kravställa, granska eller komplettera säkra IT lösningar så som system, produkter eller mjukvara.
 



  





 Kvalifikationer
 


* Vana att jobba självständigt och i grupp samt vara resultat- och leveransinriktad
* Erfarenhet av att jobba inom Försvarsmakten eller försvarsindustrin
* God förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* God förmåga att tänka utifrån kundens behov och perspektiv
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom området



  





 Kvalifikationer för ämnesområden. Har erfarenhet av minst 4st områden nedan:
 


* Server (Windows, Linux, VM-ware)
* Cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP, Private Cloud)
* Klientmiljöer för Mac, Windows och Linux
* Nätverksteknik (Switchning, Brandväggar, Routing, Wifi mm)
* Säkra lösningar (PKI, kryptering, VPN, CIS mm)
* Design av system inkl. säkerhetskomponenter. Framtagning av arkitektur och design inkl. lösningsförslag för tillämpningar
* Kunskap om vilka metoder en angripare kan använda sig av för att påverka eller ta över IT-system
* Hot och riskanalyser
* Erfarenhet av teknisk granskning av system och komponenter
* Kravfångst, kravanalys och kravnedbrytning
* Standarder, regelverk och processer inom säkerhetsområdet så som svenska KFS 3.1, ISD, Signalskydd samt utländska standarder och regelverk så som NATO, BSI, MCSS och Common Criteria



  





 Meriterande
 


* God erfarenhet av utvecklingsprocesser
* Internationella standarder (NIST, ISO 27000, m.fl.)
* Erfarenhet av konsultroll
* Någon eller några av följande informationssäkerhetcertifieringar: CISSP, CRISC, CISM, CSSP eller annan Cloud eller plattformsspecifik certifiering.



  





  





 JAMSEC AB är en oberoende konsultbyrå som är experter inom informationssäkerhet, Säkerhetsskydd och Säkerhetskultur.
 



 Våra kunder är verksamma inom sektorerna; Försvar, Telecom, Energi, Konsult, Stadsnät, Infrastruktur m.fl.
 



  





 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan!

title: HR Data Management Specialist
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences to their customers. More than 150,000 businesses - including many of the world's largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
   

  

 We dream big - for our company, our customers and our employees - and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries - probably somewhere near you!
   

  

 We are currently transforming Sinch HR, to be fit for purpose for the future. This includes the design of new global HR processes, implementation of new HR technology and improved ways of working, with the establishment of a Global HR Operations capability.
   

  

 To strengthen HR Operations, we are now looking for a HR Data Management Specialist.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The HR Data Management Specialist is responsible for managing and ensuring the accuracy, integrity, and compliance of HR data within the organization. The role involves adherence to legal and regulatory requirements and supporting the organization in maintaining best practices in data governance.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**HR Data Management**
* Update and maintain organizational and employee data in HR systems, ensuring data accuracy, integrity and security.
* Regularly audit HR data to identify and rectify inconsistencies, inaccuracies or errors.
* Develop and implement data entry protocols and data management best practices.
* Collaborate with HR and IT to enhance data management processes, tools and efficiency.


**Compliance**
* Ensure HR data and processes comply with local, national, and international labor laws and regulations.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of relevant labor laws, data privacy regulations (e.g GDPR), and industry standards and update HR policies and practices accordingly.
* Prepare and submit compliance reports to regulartory authorities as required.
* Support internal and external audits by providing necessary data and documentation.


**Reporting and Analytics**
* Generate HR reports and dashboards for management and other stakeholders to support decision-making.
* Analyse HR data to identify trends and provide insights into HR strategy and development.


**HR Operations team member**
* Serve as second line support to HR Service Centre and back up as first line when needed.


 The role is part of the Global HR Operations team and is based at our HQ in Stockholm. It reports to the Regional HR Operations Manager APAC/EMEA, who will be based in India.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity to join a newly created team and build the HR OPS capabilities globally.
   

  

**About You**
 To be successful in the role you have a real passion for HR, Data and communication and you love working in a global environment! You have excellent communication skills. You have strong understanding of HR IS platforms and data management principles and good analytical skills with the ability to interpret and leverage HR data.
   

  

* Proficiency in using HR systems, working with data and analytics
* Experience of help desk software systems to manage inquiries, track tickets, and document resolutions
* Demonstrated experience in providing high-quality customer service within HR.
* Basic knowledge of HR policies, processes and audit experience.
* Knowledge of data laws, regulations and compliance standards


**Our Values**
 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple" and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
   

  

**Bring your authentic self to Sinch**
 Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
   

  

 We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
   

  

 Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
   

  

 If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/

title: Developer Support Engineer for Data Calling
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on their mobile phones. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year. Our technology powers the world's leading communications platforms.
   

  

 Are you passionate about being the go-to resource for developer inquiries? Do you thrive on analysis, optimization, and clear communication? If so, we want you on our team! We're expanding our third-line support for our Voice, Video, and Verification products and are looking for someone who can help us become the best we can be. Are you ready for the challenge?
   

  

 We're strengthening our engineering team with a Developer Support Engineer who will serve as the bridge between our clients' developers and our internal team.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be responsible for enhancing the developer experience by continuously improving our reference implementations, sample apps, and documentation, while providing top-notch support to our clients' developers. You'll troubleshoot customer integrations of our SDKs and APIs, track FAQs, and identify patterns that highlight potential SDK improvements. Our SDKs use WebRTC technology, making it easy to add real-time, in-app voice and video calling to our clients' websites or apps.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Handle and analyse third-line support inquiries to ensure our FAQs remain relevant.
* Help keep our developer documentation up-to-date and user-friendly.
* Build reference implementations and sample apps to simplify the integration of our voice, video, and verification SDKs.
* Collaborate closely with other engineers to stay informed about important updates and new releases.
* Focus on quality assurance and provide first-class support to developers.
* Communicate effectively with clients, ensuring their technical issues are resolved promptly and clearly.
* Conduct QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices to ensure optimal performance and usability.


**Requirements**
* Degree in IT, engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* High proficiency in English, particularly in writing.
* Strong communication skills, with experience in handling customer support.
* Experience in app development or relevant development roles.
* Strong understanding of the development process and effective communication with developers.
* Interest in voice and video calling technologies.


**Good to have**
* Familiarity with Android and iOS application development (Kotlin, Swift).
* Experience of using tools such as Datadog and Kibana for monitoring systems and performing root cause analysis through detailed log and metric exploration.
* Previous experience in a similar support role.
* Experience with voice and video calling.
* Familiarity with WebRTC technology, IP networks or telecom networks.
* Experience in manual and automated QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices.

title: Regional Director, Nordics
description:
Rubrik’s Sales organization is a united group of elite cross-functional sales professionals that help companies & government entities achieve resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. We offer continuous professional growth and opportunity through our world-class sales enablement program. Our One Rubrik selling approach provides all the resources you need to exceed your goals, maximize your earnings potential, and take your career to the next level. All this while doing something truly purposeful, protecting the world's data.
   

  

 We’re seeking a strong leader for our business in the Nordic region, someone who will build on the existing team and lead the organization forward to achieve further goals and successes. You will play a crucial role in building an inclusive and highly motivated team across the Nordics & to capitalize on the market opportunity and springboard your career to the next stage of success.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Overall responsibility for the growth of the team and regional budget
* Develop and implement a comprehensive strategy that maximizes Rubrik’s position and opportunities across the Nordic region
* Build and retain the partner ecosystem and work closely with focused partners to foster collaboration and opportunity
* Lead the Rubrik Nordic sales teams in close co-operation with international experts and thought leaders.
* Hands on approach and thought leadership into account strategies and focus
* Sell and promotes the introduction of Rubrik to prospects and provide guidance to the team on strategy, sales process and CxO level selling.
* Participate in strategic and tactical planning for the region and a key member of the EMEA Management team.
* Develop and execute a focus plan to maximize revenue and growth across Northern European countries.
* Drive accurate team forecasting practice in line with management expectations.
* Conduct weekly progress meetings with the sales team.
* Assist in the development of short, medium, and long term plans to achieve strategic objectives.
* Regularly interact across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure region objectives are met.
* Ability to influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations is important.


**Required Skills**
* Minimum 3+ years of experience in sales leadership and experience on working with complex Mid Market to Enterprise organizations
* Relevant domain experience across backup, cloud, datacenter & security / SaaS environments.
* Proven track record in a sales-driven organization, selling technology-related products and services
* Understanding of MEDDPICC sales methodology
* Solid written, verbal, and presentation skills
* Creative with strong problem-solving skills and an ability to succeed in a fast-paced environment
* Proven ability to work well as part of an extended sales team
* Knowledge of Rubrik’s specific domain area
* Leader and self-motivated.


 Join Us in Securing the World's Data
   

  

 Rubrik (NYSE: RBRK) is on a mission to secure the world’s data. With Zero Trust Data Security™, we help organizations achieve business resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. Rubrik Security Cloud, powered by machine learning, secures data across enterprise, cloud, and SaaS applications. We help organizations uphold data integrity, deliver data availability that withstands adverse conditions, continuously monitor data risks and threats, and restore businesses with their data when infrastructure is attacked.
   

  

 Linkedin | X (formerly Twitter) | Instagram | Rubrik.com
   

  

 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion @ Rubrik
   

  

 At Rubrik we are committed to building and sustaining a culture where people of all backgrounds are valued, know they belong, and believe they can succeed here.
   

  

 Rubrik's goal is to hire and promote the best person for the job, no matter their background. In doing so, Rubrik is committed to correcting systemic processes and cultural norms that have prevented equal representation. This means we review our current efforts with the intent to offer fair hiring, promotion, and compensation opportunities to people from historically underrepresented communities, and strive to create a company culture where all employees feel they can bring their authentic selves to work and be successful.
   

  

 Our DEI strategy focuses on three core areas of our business and culture:
   

  

* Our Company: Build a diverse company that provides equitable access to growth and success for all employees globally.
* Our Culture: Create an inclusive environment where authenticity thrives and people of all backgrounds feel like they belong.
* Our Communities: Expand our commitment to diversity, equity, & inclusion within and beyond our company walls to invest in future generations of underrepresented talent and bring innovation to our clients.


 Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
   

  

 Rubrik is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
   

  

 Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
   

  

 Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please contact us at hr@rubrik.com if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.
   

  

 EEO IS THE LAW
   

  

 EEO IS THE LAW - POSTER SUPPLEMENT
   

  

 PAY TRANSPARENCY NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION
